ingredients: Chicken pieces, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chili peppers, curry leaves, spices (such as turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder), oil, salt, water, cilantro leaves for garnish.
preparation: Start by marinating chicken pieces in a mixture of yogurt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt, allowing it to marinate for at least 30 minutes. In a pan, heat oil and temper mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, and dried red chilies until they release their aroma. Then, add finely chopped onions and saute until golden brown before adding ginger-garlic paste and cooking until fragrant. Incorporate finely chopped tomatoes, cooking until softened. Add the marinated chicken along with any remaining marinade, ensuring it's evenly coated with the masala mixture. Let the chicken cook on medium heat until tender, adjusting seasoning as needed. Finally, garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti .

ingredients: Rice, tamarind pulp, green chili peppers, curry leaves, peanuts, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, salt, oil.
preparation: Start by cooking one cup of rice until each grain is soft and separate. While the rice is cooking, prepare the tamarind paste by soaking a lemon-sized ball of tamarind in warm water for about 15-20 minutes, then extract the pulp and strain it. In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, chana dal, urad dal, dried red chilies, curry leaves, green chilies (optional), turmeric powder, and asafoetida, and sauté until fragrant. Then, add the tamarind pulp, salt, and cook until the mixture thickens. Once the rice and tamarind mixture are cooled, gently mix them together until the rice is evenly coated. In a separate pan, prepare the tempering by heating oil, adding mustard seeds, chana dal, urad dal, dried red chilies, curry leaves, and asafoetida, and frying until golden brown. Pour the tempering over the prepared Pulihora, mix gently, and let the flavors meld before serving. Pulihora is a tangy and flavorful dish that can be enjoyed on its own or paired with accompaniments like yogurt or pickle.

ingredients: Gongura leaves (sorrel leaves), green chili peppers, onions, garlic, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, turmeric powder, salt, oil.
preparation: Start by thoroughly washing the gongura leaves and removing any tough stems. Heat a tablespoon of oil in a pan and add the gongura leaves along with chopped green chilies and garlic cloves. Sauté them until the leaves wilt and the raw smell disappears. Allow this mixture to cool. In a separate pan, heat the remaining oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, urad dal, chana dal, dried red chilies, and a pinch of asafoetida. Fry until the dal turns golden brown and the seeds splutter. Let this tempering cool down. Once both mixtures are cooled, grind them together along with soaked tamarind and salt to a coarse paste. Adjust the consistency by adding water if needed. Your Gongura Pachadi is now ready to be served! This tangy and spicy chutney pairs perfectly with hot rice and ghee.

ingredients: Fish (such as rohu or catfish), onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chili peppers, curry leaves, spices (such as turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder), tamarind pulp, salt, oil, cilantro leaves for garnish.
preparation: Start by marinating the fish pieces with a pinch of turmeric powder and salt. Let them sit for about 15-20 minutes. Meanwhile, heat oil in a deep pan or kadhai. Add mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds. Once they start to splutter, add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Then, add minced garlic, ginger, slit green chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté until the raw smell disappears. Now, add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy. Extract the pulp from the soaked tamarind and add it to the pan along with turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder. Mix well and let it simmer for a few minutes until the raw smell of the spices goes away. Add water to achieve the desired consistency of the curry. Once the curry comes to a gentle boil, add the marinated fish pieces carefully. Cook on medium heat until the fish is cooked through and the curry thickens slightly. Adjust salt if necessary. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with steamed rice or roti.

ingredients: Chicken pieces, basmati rice, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, green chili peppers, yogurt, spices (such as turmeric powder, biryani masala, garam masala), mint leaves, cilantro leaves, saffron, milk, ghee (clarified butter), oil, salt.
preparation: Start by washing and soaking the basmati rice in water for about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, marinate the chicken pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, half of the sliced onions, half of the chopped tomatoes, half of the mint leaves, half of the coriander leaves, and salt. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes. In a large pot, heat ghee and oil. Add the remaining sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnishing. To the remaining onions in the pot, add bay leaves, cinnamon sticks, cardamom pods, and cloves. Sauté for a minute. Add the marinated chicken along with the marinade and cook until the chicken is partially cooked. In another pot, boil water and add the soaked rice along with salt. Cook the rice until it's 70% done. Drain the excess water and spread half of the cooked rice over the partially cooked chicken layer. Sprinkle some garam masala powder, saffron milk, and the remaining mint and coriander leaves. Layer the remaining rice on top. Sprinkle the remaining saffron milk and fried onions. Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid and cook on low heat for about 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is fully cooked and the rice is tender. Once done, gently fluff up the biryani and serve hot with raita or salan.

ingredients: Chana dal (Bengal gram lentils), jaggery (or sugar), all-purpose flour (maida), ghee (clarified butter), cardamom powder.
preparation: Start by rinsing the chana dal thoroughly and then soaking it in water for about 3-4 hours. After soaking, drain the water and pressure cook the chana dal until it becomes soft and mushy. Once cooked, drain any excess water and let the dal cool down. In a separate pan, heat a tablespoon of ghee and add the grated jaggery. Cook it on low heat until the jaggery melts completely and forms a thick syrup-like consistency. Add the cooked chana dal to the jaggery syrup along with cardamom powder and mix well. Cook this mixture until it thickens and forms a cohesive filling. Once done, allow it to cool down. Meanwhile, prepare the dough by mixing all-purpose flour, a pinch of salt, and enough water to form a soft and pliable dough. Divide the dough and the filling into equal-sized balls. Roll out each dough ball into a small circle, place a filling ball in the center, and seal the edges carefully, ensuring there are no gaps. Flatten the stuffed dough ball gently using your palms or a rolling pin to form a disc-like shape. Heat a griddle or tawa and cook the Bobbatlu on both sides until they turn golden brown, applying ghee as needed. Repeat the process for the remaining dough and filling. Serve the warm and delicious Bobbatlu as a dessert or snack.

ingredients: Whole green gram (moong dal), rice, green chili peppers, ginger, cumin seeds, salt, oil.
preparation: Start by rinsing the green gram and rice thoroughly and then soaking them together in water for about 4-6 hours. Once soaked, drain the water and transfer the green gram and rice to a blender. Add chopped ginger, green chilies, cumin seeds, and salt. Blend the mixture into a smooth batter, adding water as needed to achieve the desired consistency. The batter should be of pouring consistency, similar to dosa batter. Heat a non-stick skillet or dosa tawa over medium heat. Once hot, pour a ladleful of the batter onto the center of the skillet and spread it evenly into a thin circle using the back of the ladle. Drizzle a teaspoon of oil around the edges of the pesarattu and let it cook for 1-2 minutes until the bottom turns golden brown and crisp. Flip the pesarattu and cook the other side for another minute. Once both sides are cooked to a golden brown color, transfer the pesarattu to a plate and repeat the process with the remaining batter. Serve the hot and crispy pesarattu with coconut chutney, ginger chutney, or allam pachadi (ginger pickle) for a delicious and nutritious breakfast or snack.

ingredients: Raw banana (plantain), chickpea flour (besan), rice flour, chili powder, baking soda, salt, oil for deep frying.
preparation: Start by peeling the raw bananas and slicing them into thin round slices. In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour, rice flour, red chili powder, turmeric powder, baking soda, and salt. Add water gradually to make a smooth and thick batter, ensuring there are no lumps. The consistency of the batter should be thick enough to coat the banana slices well. Heat oil in a deep frying pan or kadhai over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, dip the banana slices into the prepared batter, ensuring they are well coated on all sides. Carefully drop the coated banana slices into the hot oil one by one. Fry them in batches, making sure not to overcrowd the pan. Fry the bajjis until they turn golden brown and crisp on all sides, flipping them occasionally for even cooking. Once done, remove the bajjis from the oil using a slotted spoon and drain them on paper towels to remove excess oil. Serve the hot and crispy Aratikaya Bajji immediately with your favorite chutney or sauce. Enjoy this delicious snack with a hot cup of tea or coffee!

ingredients: Horse gram lentils, tamarind pulp, onions, tomatoes, garlic, green chili peppers, curry leaves, spices (such as turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder), salt, oil.
preparation: Start by rinsing the horse gram thoroughly and then soaking it in water for about 4-6 hours or overnight. Once soaked, drain the water and pressure cook the horse gram with fresh water until it becomes soft and mushy. Meanwhile, extract the pulp from the soaked tamarind and keep it aside. In a separate pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Once they start to splutter, add dry red chilies, chopped onions, crushed garlic, chopped ginger, and curry leaves. Sauté until the onions turn golden brown. Then, add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for a couple of minutes. Add the cooked horse gram along with its water to the pan. Also, add the tamarind pulp and adjust the consistency by adding more water if needed. Let the mixture simmer for about 10-15 minutes on low heat, allowing the flavors to blend together. Once done, garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot Ulavacharu with steamed rice or idlis for a comforting and nutritious meal.

ingredients: Baby eggplants, onions, tomatoes, peanuts, sesame seeds, coconut, ginger-garlic paste, spices (such as turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala), tamarind pulp, salt, oil, cilantro leaves for garnish.
preparation: Start by washing the brinjals and making a "+" slit at the base without cutting through. In a mixing bowl, combine roasted and powdered peanuts, sesame seeds, grated dry coconut, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, tamarind paste, jaggery or sugar, and salt. Stuff this mixture into the brinjals evenly. Heat oil in a deep pan or kadhai and add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Once they start to splutter, add curry leaves and a pinch of asafoetida. Then, add chopped onions and slit green chilies. Sauté until the onions turn translucent. Carefully place the stuffed brinjals in the pan, ensuring they are in a single layer. Cover and cook on low heat for about 10-15 minutes, occasionally turning the brinjals gently to ensure even cooking. Once the brinjals are cooked through and tender, garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot Gutti Vankaya Curry with rice or roti for a delicious and satisfying meal.

ingredients: Rice or  millet or maize, Yeast or fermentation starter, Water
preparation: Start by soaking the chosen grains, which can be rice, millet, or maize, in water to soften them. Once softened, grind the grains into a coarse paste. Mix this paste with water to create a fermentable mixture. Add yeast or a fermentation starter, often obtained from previously fermented batches, to kickstart the fermentation process. Let the mixture ferment for several days, allowing the yeast to convert the sugars in the grains into alcohol. Throughout the fermentation period, stir the mixture occasionally to aid the process. Once fermentation is complete, strain the liquid to remove any solid particles, resulting in a clear, slightly effervescent rice beer ready for consumption.

ingredients: All-purpose flour, minced meat (usually pork or chicken), onions, garlic, ginger, cilantro, soy sauce, salt, and oil.
preparation: Begin by preparing the dough using all-purpose flour, water, and a pinch of salt. Knead the dough until it's smooth and elastic, then cover and let it rest. Meanwhile, prepare the filling by mixing minced meat with finely chopped onions, garlic, ginger, cilantro, soy sauce, and salt in a bowl. Once the dough has rested, roll it out into thin circles. Place a spoonful of the filling in the center of each circle, then fold the dough over the filling, pleating the edges to seal. Steam the Momos in a steamer basket until cooked through, typically for about 8-10 minutes. Serve hot with a spicy dipping sauce, and enjoy this delicious and comforting dish!

ingredients: Millet flour,Water
preparation: Start by mixing millet flour with water in a pot or saucepan. Stir the mixture well to ensure there are no lumps. Place the pot over medium heat and bring the mixture to a boil, stirring constantly to prevent it from sticking to the bottom of the pot. Once it comes to a boil, reduce the heat to low and continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until the mixture thickens to a smooth consistency similar to porridge. Zan is typically served hot and can be enjoyed plain or with toppings such as sugar or milk.

ingredients: Wheat noodles, mixed vegetables such as carrots, cabbage, and spinach, meat options like chicken, pork, or beef, onions, garlic, ginger, chili peppers, oil, salt, and water.
preparation: Start by heating oil in a pot over medium heat. Add chopped onions, garlic, ginger, and chili peppers, sautéing until fragrant. Then, add your choice of meat (chicken, pork, or beef) and cook until it's no longer pink. Next, toss in a mix of vegetables like carrots, cabbage, and spinach, allowing them to soften slightly. Pour in water and bring the mixture to a gentle boil. Season generously with salt. Finally, add wheat noodles to the pot, cooking them until tender yet firm. Serve hot, and enjoy this hearty and aromatic noodle soup.

ingredients: Tender bamboo shoots, succulent pork, fiery chili peppers, pungent ginger, aromatic garlic, a pinch of salt for seasoning, and oil for cooking.
preparation: Begin by heating oil in a pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions, garlic, and ginger, sautéing until they turn golden brown and fragrant. Next, add sliced bamboo shoots and cook them until they are tender. Then, add diced pork pieces and continue cooking until they are cooked through and golden brown. Season the mixture with salt and crushed chili peppers according to taste. Finally, add a splash of water to create a flavorful sauce and let it simmer for a few minutes until the flavors meld together. Serve hot with steamed rice, and enjoy this delicious and aromatic pork and bamboo shoot curry.

ingredients: Pork, bamboo shoots, and salt.
preparation: Begin with marinating the pork with salt, infusing it with flavor and allowing it to cure. Next, the pork is carefully smoked, either over an open fire or in a smokehouse, imparting a rich and smoky essence that elevates its taste to new heights. Meanwhile, bamboo shoots are prepared, often by slicing them thinly and then boiling them until they reach a tender consistency. Once both the smoked pork and bamboo shoots are ready, they are combined, allowing their distinct flavors to mingle harmoniously. Pehak is typically served alongside steamed rice, providing a deeply satisfying and flavorful meal.

ingredients: Duck, ginger, garlic, chili peppers, bamboo shoots, salt, and water.
preparation: Begin by marinating the duck pieces with a blend of ginger, garlic, and chili peppers, infusing them with a tantalizing heat and fragrance. Next, slice bamboo shoots into thin pieces and add them to the marinated duck, enhancing the dish with their unique crunch and earthy flavor. Then, in a pot, combine the marinated duck and bamboo shoots with water, allowing them to simmer gently until the duck becomes tender and succulent, and the flavors meld together to perfection. Finally, season the dish with salt to taste, balancing the flavors and bringing out the natural richness of the duck and bamboo shoots. Poora Haah is typically served hot with steamed rice.

ingredients: Flattened rice (chura), potatoes, onions, tomatoes, green peas, ginger, garlic, chili peppers, mustard oil, an assortment of spices including turmeric, cumin, and coriander, and salt.
preparation: Start by soaking the flattened rice in water until it softens, then drain and set aside. In a pan, heat mustard oil and sauté finely chopped onions, ginger, garlic, and chili peppers until they turn golden brown and fragrant. Add diced potatoes and cook until they are tender, then incorporate chopped tomatoes and cook until they break down and form a thick gravy. Next, add green peas and any other vegetables of choice, along with the soaked flattened rice. Season the mixture generously with turmeric, cumin, coriander, and salt, stirring well to combine all the ingredients evenly. Let the mixture simmer gently until the flavors meld together and the vegetables are cooked to perfection. Serve Chura Sabji hot, garnished with fresh cilantro leaves, and accompanied by steamed rice.

ingredients: Bamboo shoots, garlic, ginger, chili peppers, salt, and oil.
preparation: Start by slicing the bamboo shoots thinly and ensuring they are properly cleaned. Then, heat oil in a pan and add finely chopped garlic, ginger, and chili peppers, allowing them to infuse the oil with their aromatic essence. Once the spices are fragrant, add the sliced bamboo shoots to the pan and stir-fry them until they are tender yet retain a slight crunch. Season the dish with salt according to taste preferences. The result is a delectable and aromatic stir-fry that showcases the unique flavor of bamboo shoots combined with the pungent kick of garlic, ginger, and chili peppers. Serve Bamboo Shoot Fry as a flavorful side dish alongside rice or as a tasty addition to any meal.

ingredients: Finger millet (ragi) and water.
preparation: Start by grinding the finger millet into a fine powder. Then, in a pot, mix the ground finger millet with water to form a thick, creamy porridge-like consistency. Cook the mixture over medium heat, stirring continuously to prevent lumps from forming, until it reaches the desired thickness. Marua can be served hot as is or sweetened with sugar or jaggery according to taste preferences.

ingredients: Fish (usually freshwater fish like rohu or catla), tomatoes, green chili peppers, mustard oil, fenugreek seeds, turmeric powder, salt, water, coriander leaves.
preparation: Begin by marinating freshwater fish pieces, such as rohu or catla, with turmeric powder and salt. Meanwhile, heat mustard oil in a pan and sauté chopped tomatoes and slit green chilies until soft. Add the marinated fish to the pan along with water, allowing it to gently simmer until cooked through. Then, infuse the curry with sourness using either lemon juice or tamarind pulp, adjusting to taste. For an extra layer of flavor, consider tempering mustard seeds, dried red chilies, fenugreek seeds, and curry leaves in mustard oil before drizzling over the curry. Serve hot alongside steamed rice.

ingredients: Four medium-sized potatoes, boiled and peeled, then mashed until smooth. Additionally, finely chop one onion and 2-3 green chilies, and gather 2 tablespoons of mustard oil and salt to taste.
preparation: Begin by boiling and peeling four medium-sized potatoes until tender, then allow them to cool. Once cooled, mash the potatoes in a bowl until smooth, leaving some small lumps for texture if desired. Next, add finely chopped onions, green chilies, two tablespoons of mustard oil, and salt to taste to the mashed potatoes, ensuring all ingredients are thoroughly mixed. For added flavor, consider incorporating optional ingredients such as finely chopped fresh coriander leaves, a dash of lemon juice, roasted cumin powder, or red chili powder. Taste the mixture and adjust seasoning as needed before serving. Typically enjoyed at room temperature or slightly warm, Aloo Pitika pairs wonderfully with rice, dal, or any main course.

ingredients: Assam tea leaves, fresh water, and optionally, milk and sugar.
preparation: Start by boiling fresh, filtered water in a kettle until it reaches a rolling boil, aiming for around 90-95°C (195-205°F). Measure out the desired amount of Assam tea leaves, typically around 1 teaspoon per cup of water, and place them into a teapot or mug. Pour the hot water over the tea leaves, ensuring they are fully submerged, and cover the vessel to let the tea steep for 3 to 5 minutes, depending on your preference for strength. After steeping, strain the tea leaves using a tea strainer or remove the infuser if using a teapot with an infuser. Optionally, add a splash of milk and sugar to taste, stirring well to combine.

ingredients: Raw papaya, pulses, and various vegetables to achieve its distinctive taste.
preparation: Start by soaking a handful of pulses such as chickpeas or black gram overnight. The next day, grind the soaked pulses into a coarse paste. Then, peel and chop a raw papaya into small pieces. In a pot, combine the ground pulses with the chopped papaya, along with any other vegetables of your choice such as pumpkin or bottle gourd. Add water and bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat and let it simmer until the vegetables are tender. In a separate pan, heat mustard oil and add fenugreek seeds, dry red chilies, and garlic. Once the spices release their aroma, add them to the simmering pot along with salt to taste. Let the Khar simmer for a few more minutes to allow the flavors to meld together. Serve Khar hot with steamed rice.

ingredients: Fermented bamboo shoots, Mustard oil, Fenugreek seeds, Dry red chilies, Garlic cloves, Salt
preparation: Begin by soaking fermented bamboo shoots in water for several hours to reduce their bitterness. After soaking, drain and rinse the bamboo shoots thoroughly. Next, finely chop the bamboo shoots and set them aside. In a pot, heat mustard oil and add fenugreek seeds, dry red chilies, and garlic cloves to temper the oil. Once the spices are aromatic, add the chopped bamboo shoots to the pot and sauté for a few minutes. Then, add water and bring the mixture to a gentle boil. Allow the bamboo shoots to simmer until they are tender and cooked through. Finally, season the Omita Khar with salt to taste and serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients: Rice flour, jaggery (or sugar), grated coconut, cardamom powder, salt, water, and sometimes milk.
preparation: Begin by mixing the rice flour with water to make a smooth batter. Add a pinch of salt to enhance the flavor. In a separate pan, melt the jaggery or sugar with a little water to make a syrupy consistency. Mix in grated coconut and cardamom powder to this syrup for a sweet and aromatic filling. Now, take small portions of the rice flour batter and flatten them into discs. Place a spoonful of the sweet coconut mixture in the center of each disc and fold the edges to seal it, giving it a crescent or cylindrical shape. Finally, steam the pitha until they are cooked through. Once done, serve them warm for a delightful treat that perfectly balances sweetness and flavor.

ingredients: Eggplant (preferably small ones), mustard oil, green chilies, onions, coriander leaves, salt, and optionally roasted or fried fish.
preparation: Start by roasting the eggplants directly over a flame or in a preheated oven until the skin is charred and the flesh is soft. Let them cool, then peel off the charred skin and mash the flesh in a bowl. Next, finely chop green chilies, onions, and coriander leaves. Mix them into the mashed eggplant along with a generous amount of mustard oil and salt to taste. Optionally, you can add pieces of roasted or fried fish to enhance the flavor. Once all the ingredients are well combined, Bengena Pitika is ready to serve. It pairs excellently with steamed rice and is often enjoyed as a side dish or accompaniment to a traditional Assamese meal.

ingredients: Tender pieces of meat (usually pork or chicken), mustard greens (xokot), mustard oil, minced garlic, grated ginger, sliced green chilies, turmeric powder, and salt.
preparation: Start by heating mustard oil in a pan and sautéing minced garlic, grated ginger, and sliced green chilies until fragrant. Then, add the meat pieces, typically pork or chicken, and cook them until they brown and release their juices. Season with turmeric powder and salt before covering the pan to let the meat cook until tender. Once the meat is almost done, add finely chopped mustard greens to the pan and cook until they wilt and blend into the dish. Adjust the seasoning if necessary and serve this flavorful Xokota Diya Mangxo hot, accompanied by steamed rice or Assamese rice cakes.

ingredients: Tender pieces of meat, such as pork, chicken, or fish, which are marinated in a mixture of mustard oil, garlic paste, ginger paste, finely chopped green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and optionally, a blend of spices like cumin powder, coriander powder, and red chili powder.
preparation: Start by marinating tender meat pieces—commonly pork, chicken, or fish—in a flavorful blend of mustard oil, garlic paste, ginger paste, finely chopped green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and optional spices like cumin powder, coriander powder, or red chili powder. Allow the meat to soak up the vibrant flavors for at least 1-2 hours, or ideally overnight in the refrigerator. Once marinated, thread the meat onto skewers and grill them over medium-high heat until they're cooked through and charred on the outside, typically taking around 10-15 minutes. Serve the succulent Khorikaa hot, garnished with fresh coriander leaves and lemon wedges, alongside rice, flatbreads, or chutneys.

ingredients: Tender meat pieces such as pork, chicken, or fish, mustard oil, garlic paste, ginger paste, finely chopped green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and optional spices like cumin powder, coriander powder, or red chili powder.
preparation: Begin by marinating tender meat pieces—such as pork, chicken, or fish—in a mixture of mustard oil, garlic paste, ginger paste, finely chopped green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and optional spices like cumin powder, coriander powder, or red chili powder. Ensure the meat is thoroughly coated and let it marinate for at least 1-2 hours, or preferably overnight in the refrigerator. Once marinated, thread the meat onto skewers and grill over medium-high heat until cooked through and charred, typically taking around 10-15 minutes. Serve hot, garnished with fresh coriander leaves, and accompanied by rice, flatbreads, or chutneys.

ingredients: Wheat flour, sattu (roasted gram flour), onions, green chilies, ginger, garlic, mustard oil, ajwain (carom seeds), garam masala, amchur (dried mango powder), salt, tomatoes, eggplants, potatoes, and coriander leaves.
preparation: Start by making the dough using whole wheat flour, salt, ajwain (carom seeds), and water. For the stuffing, roast sattu with chopped onions, green chilies, ginger, garlic, mustard oil, ajwain, garam masala, amchur, and salt. Form small balls of the dough and stuff them with the sattu mixture. Then, bake or roast the stuffed balls until they turn golden brown. For the chokha, roast or boil tomatoes, eggplants, and potatoes, and mash them together with chopped onions, green chilies, garlic, mustard oil, salt, and coriander leaves. Serve the litti with chokha and a dollop of ghee.

ingredients: Whole wheat flour, sattu (roasted gram flour), onions, green chilies, ginger, garlic, ajwain (carom seeds), salt, garam masala, amchur (dried mango powder), and ghee.
preparation: Mix roasted gram flour (sattu) with finely chopped onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, and spices. Stuff this mixture into wheat dough balls, then roll out the stuffed dough into parathas. Cook the parathas on a hot griddle with ghee until they turn golden brown.

ingredients: Dried yellow peas (chana), onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, salt, coriander leaves, and mustard oil.
preparation: Boil soaked black chickpeas until tender. Sauté the boiled chickpeas with onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, and spices until the flavors meld and the mixture thickens slightly.

ingredients: Minced meat (usually mutton or chicken), onions, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, coriander leaves, gram flour, garam masala, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, salt, and oil for frying.
preparation: Marinate minced meat with spices. Shape the marinated meat into patties or skewers. Grill or fry the kebabs until they are cooked through.

ingredients: Rice flour, yellow lentils (arhar dal), ginger, green chilies, cumin seeds, mustard seeds, asafoetida, salt, and water.
preparation: Make a dough of rice flour. Stuff the dough with a mixture of spiced lentils. Shape the mixture into dumplings, then steam the dumplings until they are fully cooked.

ingredients: All-purpose flour, ghee, sugar, water, and oil for frying.
preparation: Create layers of refined flour dough. Fry the layers until they turn crispy, then soak them in sugar syrup until they absorb the sweetness.

ingredients: Makhana (fox nuts), milk, sugar, cardamom powder, saffron strands, chopped nuts (such as almonds, cashews, and pistachios), and ghee.
preparation: Simmer foxnuts (makhana) in milk until they become soft. Sweeten the mixture with sugar and add cardamom and nuts for flavor.

ingredients: Dried yellow peas (choora), onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, salt, coriander leaves, and mustard oil.
preparation: Mix boiled black chickpeas with flattened rice (choora). Temper the mixture with spices and garnish it with fresh cilantro.

ingredients: Flour (maida), sugar, ghee (clarified butter), and optionally flavored with cardamom powder or saffron.
preparation: Fry wheat flour dough balls until they become golden brown. Then, soak the fried balls in sugar syrup until they absorb the syrup completely.

ingredients: Poppy seeds (postaa-dana), ghee, sugar, milk, cardamom powder, chopped nuts (such as almonds, cashews, and pistachios), and saffron strands.
preparation: Roast poppy seeds in ghee until they release their aroma. Cook the roasted poppy seeds with sugar syrup until the mixture achieves a halwa-like consistency.

ingredients: Rice flour, chana dal (split chickpeas), spices such as cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and mustard oil.
preparation: Make a dough using rice flour, kneaded with water and spices. Shape the dough into elongated cylindrical rolls and steam them until cooked. Once cooked, slice them and optionally fry for a crispy texture.

ingredients: Gram flour (besan), yogurt, spices such as cumin seeds, mustard seeds, turmeric powder, green chilies, and coriander leaves.
preparation: Soak black gram dal and rice overnight. Grind them into a smooth batter, adding spices and salt. Pour ladlefuls of batter onto a hot griddle, spreading it into thin circles, and cook until golden brown on both sides.

ingredients: Chickpea flour (besan), fenugreek leaves (methi), turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin seeds, and oil for frying.
preparation: Mix together grated bottle gourd (lauki), gram flour, wheat flour, and spices to form a firm dough. Shape the dough into cylindrical rolls and steam them until cooked. Once cooked, slice them and optionally temper with mustard seeds and curry leaves.

ingredients: Black gram dal (urad dal), ginger, green chilies, asafoetida, salt, and oil for frying.
preparation: Soak black gram dal overnight, then grind it into a smooth batter along with ginger, garlic, green chilies, and spices. Drop spoonfuls of batter into hot oil and deep fry until golden brown and crispy.

ingredients: Gram flour (besan), water, turmeric powder, chopped onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, and oil for cooking.
preparation: Prepare a batter using gram flour, water, and spices to a smooth pouring consistency. Heat a skillet, pour a ladleful of batter, and spread it thinly. Cook until both sides are golden brown and crispy.

ingredients: Green mangoes, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, salt, and mustard oil.
preparation: Cook split pigeon peas (arhar dal) until soft. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and dried red chilies. Once they splutter, add chopped tomatoes, green chilies, turmeric, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and mashed. Add the cooked dal, mix well, and simmer until flavors meld.

ingredients: Black gram dal (urad dal), rice, fenugreek seeds, cumin seeds, and salt.
preparation: Mix together powdered urad dal, spices, and water to form a thick batter. Drop spoonfuls of batter into hot oil and deep fry until they puff up and turn golden brown.

ingredients: Rice flour, yogurt, spices like cumin seeds, green chilies, and mustard oil.
preparation: Soak rice and black gram dal overnight. Grind them into a smooth batter, adding spices and salt. Spread the batter thinly on banana leaves and cook on a griddle until crispy.

ingredients: Flattened rice (poha), chopped onions, green chilies, mustard seeds, curry leaves, turmeric powder, and salt.
preparation: Make a batter using black gram dal, rice flour, spices, and water. Heat a griddle, pour a ladleful of batter, and spread it thinly. Cook until crispy on both sides.

ingredients: Red ants, green chilies, garlic, ginger, tamarind pulp, salt, and oil.
preparation: Collect red ants and their eggs, then clean them thoroughly. Grind them into a paste along with red chilies, garlic, ginger, tamarind pulp, and salt. Adjust the consistency with water if necessary. Optionally, temper the chutney with mustard seeds and curry leaves for added flavor.

ingredients: Fish (such as pomfret, kingfish, or mackerel), coconut milk, tamarind paste, curry leaves, mustard seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, and coriander leaves.
preparation: Marinate fish pieces with turmeric, salt, and lemon juice. Prepare a gravy by sautéing onions, garlic, ginger, tomatoes, and spices. Add coconut milk and tamarind paste for tanginess. Simmer the fish in the gravy until cooked through. Serve with steamed rice.

ingredients: Pork, vinegar, ginger, garlic, onions, green chilies, cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, turmeric powder, and black pepper.
preparation: Cook pork pieces with vinegar, garlic, ginger, onions, and spices until tender. Grind together red chilies, cloves, cinnamon, and peppercorns into a paste. Add this paste to the cooked pork along with liver, and simmer until flavors meld.

ingredients: Meat (such as pork, chicken, or lamb), vinegar, garlic, ginger, onions, tomatoes, red chilies, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, cinnamon, cloves, and sugar.
preparation: Marinate meat (usually pork) with vinegar, garlic, ginger, and spices overnight. Sauté onions until golden brown, then add the marinated meat and cook until tender. Adjust seasoning and serve hot.

ingredients: Chicken or lamb, grated coconut, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and tamarind pulp.
preparation: Dry roast grated coconut, poppy seeds, and spices until fragrant. Grind into a fine paste with tamarind pulp. Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until brown, then add the spice paste and cook. Add meat (chicken or lamb) and simmer until cooked through.

ingredients: Coconut milk, eggs, sugar, flour, ghee, and nutmeg.
preparation: Mix together coconut milk, sugar, flour, and egg yolks to form a smooth batter. Layer the batter in a greased baking dish, baking each layer until set and golden brown. Serve warm or chilled.

ingredients: Cashew apples or coconut sap.
preparation: Distill cashew apples or coconut palm sap to produce a potent liquor known as feni. It's typically consumed straight or used as a base for cocktails.

ingredients: Prawns, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, vinegar, red chili powder, turmeric powder, cinnamon, cloves, and sugar.
preparation: Marinate prawns with vinegar, garlic, ginger, and spices. Sauté onions until golden brown, then add the marinated prawns and cook until done. Adjust seasoning and serve hot or cold.

ingredients: Rice, coconut, yeast, sugar, and salt.
preparation: Soak rice and urad dal overnight, then grind into a smooth batter. Add coconut milk, sugar, and yeast, and allow the batter to ferment. Steam in molds until cooked through, then serve with curries.

ingredients: Mixed vegetables (such as potatoes, carrots, peas), onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, spices like turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, pav (bread rolls), and butter.
preparation: Saute mixed vegetables with onions, tomatoes, garlic, ginger, and spices until tender. Serve hot with buttered pav (bread rolls).

ingredients: Chicken or fish, coriander leaves, mint leaves, green chilies, ginger, garlic, vinegar, lime juice, and spices such as turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and black pepper.
preparation: Marinate chicken or fish with a paste of coriander leaves, green chilies, garlic, ginger, and spices. Grill or fry until cooked through. Serve hot with lime wedges.

ingredients: Gram flour (besan), yogurt, water, ginger-green chili paste, turmeric powder, salt, citric acid or lemon juice, and tempering ingredients such as mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies.
preparation: Prepare a batter using fermented rice and chickpea flour, along with yogurt and spices. Steam the batter until cooked through. Once done, temper with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies.

ingredients: Gram flour (besan), yogurt, water, turmeric powder, ginger-green chili paste, salt, and tempering ingredients like mustard seeds, sesame seeds, and curry leaves.
preparation: Mix together besan (gram flour), yogurt, turmeric, and water to form a smooth batter. Cook the batter on a greased surface until it thickens. Spread the cooked batter thinly, allow it to cool, then roll it into tight cylinders.

ingredients: Wheat flour, fenugreek leaves (methi), yogurt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, sesame seeds, and oil for cooking.
preparation: Combine whole wheat flour, grated vegetables (like spinach or fenugreek leaves), yogurt, spices, and oil to form a smooth dough. Roll out the dough into thin circles and cook on a griddle until golden brown, using oil or ghee as needed.

ingredients: Mixed vegetables (such as potatoes, sweet potatoes, eggplant, green beans), fenugreek dumplings (muthiya), spices like turmeric powder, coriander-cumin powder, garam masala, and sugar, as well as grated coconut and coriander leaves for garnish.
preparation: Prepare a mixture of various vegetables like potatoes, yam, eggplant, and beans, along with spices. Cook the vegetables with a paste made from coconut, cilantro, and spices until tender

ingredients: Yogurt, gram flour (besan), water, ginger-green chili paste, turmeric powder, salt, sugar, and tempering ingredients like mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, and dried red chilies.
preparation: Mix together besan (gram flour), yogurt, water, and spices to form a smooth mixture. Cook the mixture until it thickens, then temper with mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, and dried red chilies.

ingredients: Gram flour (besan), turmeric powder, carom seeds (ajwain), and water,all-purpose flour, yogurt, water, saffron, and sugar syrup.
preparation: Prepare a batter using besan (gram flour), turmeric, ajwain (carom seeds), and water. Deep fry the batter until crispy to make fafda. Serve with jalebi, a sweet made from fermented batter deep-fried and soaked in sugar syrup.

ingredients: Boiled potatoes, dabeli masala (spice mix), tamarind chutney, green chutney, roasted peanuts, pomegranate seeds, sev (fried gram flour noodles), onions, and pav (bread rolls).
preparation: Cook a spiced potato mixture with peanuts, coconut, and pomegranate seeds. Stuff this mixture into pav (bread rolls) along with chutneys, onions, and sev (crispy chickpea noodles).

ingredients: Rice, lentils (like chana dal and urad dal), yogurt, ginger-green chili paste, grated vegetables (such as bottle gourd, carrots), and spices like turmeric powder, red chili powder, and baking soda.
preparation: Mix together rice flour, chickpea flour, yogurt, grated vegetables, and spices to form a thick batter. Pour the batter into a greased pan and bake until golden brown and cooked through.

ingredients: Chickpea flour (besan), turmeric powder, ajwain (carom seeds), baking soda, salt, water, oil for deep-frying.
preparation: Prepare a dough using chickpea flour, water, and spices. Extrude the dough through a gathiya maker (a special press) into hot oil and deep fry until crispy.

ingredients: Gram flour (besan), grated bottle gourd (doodhi/lauki), fenugreek leaves (methi), turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt.
preparation: Combine grated vegetables (like bottle gourd or cabbage), chickpea flour, wheat flour, spices, and water to form a firm dough. Shape the dough into cylindrical rolls and steam until cooked through. Once done, slice and optionally temper with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies.

itemName: Makki ki Roti and Sarson ka Saag
ingredients: Maize flour (makki ka atta), water, and salt. Sarson ka Saag typically requires ingredients like mustard greens (sarson), spinach, bathua (chenopodium), ginger, garlic, green chilies, onions, tomatoes, ghee or oil, and spices like turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder.
preparation: For Makki ki Roti: Mix maize flour (makki ka atta) with water and knead it into a dough. Roll out the dough into flatbreads and cook them on a hot griddle until golden brown on both sides.For Sarson ka Saag: Boil mustard greens (sarson) and spinach until tender. Sauté them with onions, garlic, ginger, green chilies, and spices. Mash the greens and cook until flavors meld, then garnish with a dollop of butter.

ingredients: Kachri (wild melon), onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala.
preparation: Peel and chop kachri (wild cucumber) into small pieces. Sauté them with onions, tomatoes, garlic, ginger, and spices until cooked through and flavorful.

ingredients: Pearl millet (bajra), split green gram dal (moong dal), water, ginger, green chilies, cumin seeds, ghee, and salt.
preparation: Wash and soak bajra (pearl millet) and moong dal (split green gram) for a few hours. Cook them together with water, salt, and spices until soft and well-cooked. Optionally, temper with ghee, cumin seeds, and red chilies.

ingredients: Split pigeon peas (toor dal), split chickpeas (chana dal), split black gram lentils (urad dal), and red lentils (masoor dal), along with onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, turmeric powder, cumin seeds, and coriander leaves.
preparation: Mix together various dals (such as masoor dal, moong dal, and chana dal) and soak them for a few hours. Cook the soaked dals with water, salt, and spices until soft. Optionally, temper with ghee, cumin seeds, and garlic.

ingredients: Chickpea flour (besan), wheat flour, onions, green chilies, ginger, garlic, coriander leaves, spices like turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, and garam masala, and oil or ghee for cooking.
preparation: Mix besan (gram flour) with water, spices, and chopped onions, green chilies, and coriander leaves to form a dough. Roll out the dough into flatbreads and cook them on a hot griddle until golden brown on both sides.

ingredients: Yogurt, gram flour (besan), water, ginger, green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, fenugreek seeds, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chilies, asafoetida, and pakoras made from gram flour and vegetables.
preparation: Mix besan (gram flour) with water, spices, and chopped onions, green chilies, and coriander leaves to form a thick batter. Drop spoonfuls of batter into hot oil and deep fry until golden brown. Prepare a yogurt-based gravy with spices, and add the fried pakoras to it.

ingredients: Fresh green chickpeas (cholia), fresh coriander leaves, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala.
preparation: Saute fresh green chickpeas (hara cholia) with onions, garlic, ginger, green chilies, and spices until cooked through. Garnish with freshly chopped coriander leaves.

ingredients: Pearl millet flour (bajra atta), boiled and mashed potatoes, green chilies, coriander leaves, cumin seeds, salt, and oil or ghee for cooking.
preparation: Mix bajra flour with mashed potatoes, spices, and chopped coriander leaves to form a dough. Roll out the dough into flatbreads and cook them on a hot griddle until golden brown on both sides.

ingredients: Carrots, milk, sugar, ghee, cardamom powder, and chopped nuts like almonds and cashews.
preparation: Grate carrots and cook them in ghee until soft. Add milk, sugar, and cardamom powder, and cook until the mixture thickens. Garnish with chopped nuts and serve hot.

ingredients: Yogurt, water, sugar, and optionally, flavors like cardamom or saffron.
preparation: Blend yogurt with water, sugar, and a pinch of salt until smooth and frothy. Optionally, flavor with cardamom or rose water. Serve chilled.

ingredients: Yogurt, chickpea flour (besan), ghee or oil, spices like cumin seeds, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, turmeric powder, and salt.
preparation: Soak chickpeas overnight and boil until tender. Cook the boiled chickpeas with yogurt, spices, and sometimes dried fruits and nuts until the flavors meld and the sauce thickens.

ingredients: Rice, lentils (usually black gram dal or green gram dal), yogurt, ghee, spices like cumin seeds, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and salt.
preparation: Prepare a mixture of rice, lentils, vegetables, and spices. Cook the mixture in yogurt until the flavors meld and the dish thickens. It's traditionally cooked in a large pot sealed with dough and slow-cooked.

ingredients: Wheat flour, yeast or baking powder, water, ghee, sugar, and salt.
preparation: Prepare a dough using wheat flour, yeast, water, and salt. Stuff the dough with a mixture of grated vegetables, spices, and sometimes paneer (Indian cheese). Steam the stuffed dough until cooked through.

ingredients: Chickpeas, yogurt, ghee or oil, spices like cumin seeds, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, turmeric powder, and salt.
preparation: Boil chickpeas until tender. Cook the boiled chickpeas with yogurt, spices, and sometimes dried fruits and nuts until the sauce thickens.

ingredients: Black gram dal (urad dal), soaked rice, ginger, green chilies, cumin seeds, asafoetida, baking powder, and oil for frying.
preparation: Prepare a batter using black gram dal, rice, and spices. Fry spoonfuls of the batter until golden brown and crispy. Serve hot.

ingredients: Lotus stem (bhey), yogurt, ghee or oil, spices like cumin seeds, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
preparation: Peel and slice lotus stems (bhey) into thin rounds. Sauté them with spices until tender and cooked through.

ingredients: Buckwheat flour, water, potatoes, onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, cumin seeds, and salt.
preparation: Grate potatoes and mix them with spices. Shape the mixture into patties and shallow fry until golden brown and crispy.

ingredients: Rice, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, yogurt, ghee or oil, spices like cumin seeds, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
preparation: Cook rice with vegetables, spices, and sometimes meat (usually mutton) in a pressure cooker or a pot until the rice is fluffy and the flavors meld.

ingredients: Lentils (usually black gram dal or green gram dal), spices like cumin seeds, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
preparation: Prepare a mixture of spices and lentil flour. Shape the mixture into small dumplings and steam until cooked. Once done, shallow fry the dumplings until golden brown and crispy.

ingredients: Lamb or goat meat, yogurt, ghee or oil, spices like cumin seeds, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
preparation: Marinate goat meat with yogurt, spices, and sometimes papaya paste (for tenderizing). Cook the marinated meat with onions, tomatoes, and spices until tender and flavorful.

ingredients: Lamb or goat meat, yogurt, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, spices like fennel seeds, cumin seeds, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom, bay leaves, dried red chilies, turmeric powder, and salt.
preparation: Marinate lamb pieces with yogurt, spices, and Kashmiri red chili powder. Sauté onions, garlic, ginger, and spices until aromatic. Add the marinated lamb and cook until tender, adding water if necessary. Finish with a garnish of fresh coriander.

ingredients: Minced lamb or goat meat, yogurt, spices like fennel seeds, cloves, cardamom, cinnamon, bay leaves, ginger-garlic paste, and ghee.
preparation: Prepare meatballs with minced lamb, yogurt, and spices. Cook the meatballs in a yogurt-based gravy with aromatic spices until tender and flavorful.

ingredients: Chicken or lamb, yogurt, onions, ginger, garlic, bay leaves, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom, fennel seeds, coriander powder, and salt.
preparation: Cook meat (usually chicken or lamb) with yogurt, spices, and water until tender. The resulting broth is then used as a base for various Kashmiri dishes.

ingredients: Long-grain basmati rice, water, and salt.
preparation: Rinse rice thoroughly and soak for about 30 minutes. Cook the soaked rice in boiling water until tender and fluffy. Drain excess water before serving.

ingredients: Baby potatoes, yogurt, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, spices like cumin seeds, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom, bay leaves, dried red chilies, turmeric powder, and salt.
preparation: Parboil baby potatoes, then deep fry until golden brown. Cook the fried potatoes in a gravy made from yogurt, tomatoes, onions, and spices until the gravy thickens and the potatoes are tender.

ingredients: Basmati rice, mixed nuts like cashews, almonds, and raisins, spices like cloves, cinnamon, cardamom, saffron, and salt.
preparation: Saute dry fruits like cashews, almonds, and raisins in ghee until golden brown. Cook basmati rice with water, saffron, cardamom, cloves, and cinnamon until fluffy. Mix in the sautéed dry fruits and serve.

ingredients: Minced meat (usually lamb or chicken), spices like cumin powder, coriander powder, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, and salt.
preparation: Marinate meat (usually lamb or chicken) with yogurt, spices, and herbs. Skewer the marinated meat and grill or roast until cooked through and charred on the outside.

ingredients: Green tea leaves, water, saffron, cardamom pods, cinnamon sticks, almonds, and sugar.
preparation: Boil water with green tea leaves, saffron strands, cardamom pods, cinnamon sticks, and almonds until aromatic. Serve hot with a touch of honey or sugar.

ingredients: Basmati rice, onions, yogurt, mixed nuts like cashews, almonds, and raisins, spices like cloves, cinnamon, cardamom, saffron, and salt.
preparation: Saute onions until golden brown. Cook basmati rice with water, saffron, cardamom, cloves, and cinnamon until fluffy. Mix in the sautéed onions and a touch of sugar for sweetness.

ingredients: Chicken pieces, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices like cumin powder, coriander powder, paprika, turmeric powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt.
preparation: Marinate chicken pieces with yogurt, spices, and lemon juice. Grill the marinated chicken in a tandoor (clay oven) until charred and cooked through. Serve hot with mint chutney and naan.

ingredients: Rice flour, grated coconut, jaggery (or sugar), cardamom powder, and water.
preparation: Prepare a batter using rice flour, water, and sometimes coconut milk. Shape the batter into small cakes or dumplings and steam or fry them until cooked through. They can be sweet or savory, depending on the filling and toppings.

ingredients: Rice, fermented rice, water, and herbs like turmeric, ginger, and garlic.
preparation: Ferment rice and various pulses like lentils and chickpeas along with herbs and spices for several days. Once fermented, cook the mixture until it thickens, strain, and serve the liquid as a traditional alcoholic beverage.

ingredients: Rice, split black gram dal (urad dal), ginger, green chilies, cumin seeds, and salt.
preparation: Soak rice and lentils overnight, then grind into a thick batter along with spices and herbs. Deep fry spoonfuls of the batter until golden brown and crispy. Serve hot with chutney.

ingredients: Rice flour, water, salt, and oil for frying.
preparation: Mix together rice flour, water, and salt to form a dough. Roll out the dough into thin circles and cook them on a hot griddle until golden brown on both sides. The name "chilka" refers to the crispy texture of the roti.

ingredients: Wheat flour, jaggery (or sugar), grated coconut, cardamom powder, and ghee for frying.
preparation: Mix together wheat flour, sugar, ghee, and spices to form a dough. Shape the dough into small discs or shapes, then deep fry until golden brown and crispy. These sweet treats are often served during festivals.

ingredients: Chicken pieces, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices like cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, salt, and clay pot (mitti ki handi) for cooking.
preparation: Marinate chicken pieces with yogurt, spices, and lemon juice. Cook the marinated chicken in a clay pot (mitti ki handi) along with onions, tomatoes, and spices until tender and flavorful.

ingredients: Whole wheat flour, sattu (roasted gram flour), onions, green chilies, ginger, garlic, ajwain (carom seeds), salt, garam masala, amchur (dried mango powder), and ghee.
preparation: Mix roasted gram flour (sattu) with finely chopped onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, and spices. Stuff this mixture into wheat dough balls, then roll out the dough into flatbreads. Cook the parathas on a hot griddle with ghee until golden brown.

ingredients: Rice flour, jaggery (or sugar), grated coconut, cardamom powder, and ghee for frying.
preparation: Prepare a batter using rice flour, jaggery (or sugar), water, and sometimes grated coconut. Deep fry spoonfuls of the batter until golden brown and crispy.

ingredients: Flattened rice (chura), yogurt, sugar, and spices like cumin powder, black salt, and red chili powder.
preparation: Soak flattened rice (chura) in water until soft, then drain excess water. Mix the soaked chura with yogurt, sugar, and spices. Garnish with chopped fruits and nuts before serving.

ingredients: Wheat flour, sugar or jaggery, milk, cardamom powder, fennel seeds, ghee (clarified butter).
preparation: Prepare a batter using wheat flour, yogurt, sugar, and spices. Fry spoonfuls of the batter in ghee or oil until golden brown and cooked through. Serve hot as a sweet snack or dessert.

ingredients: Rice, toor dal (split pigeon peas), mixed vegetables (like carrots, beans, peas), tamarind paste, spices like mustard seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, cloves, cinnamon, curry leaves, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt.
preparation: Cook rice and lentils (usually toor dal) with vegetables like carrots, peas, and beans, along with tamarind pulp and spices like cinnamon, cloves, and bay leaves. Prepare a spice paste with coconut, red chilies, and other spices, then mix it with the cooked rice and lentils. Garnish with fried cashews and serve hot.

ingredients: Dosa batter (made from rice and urad dal), potato filling (potatoes, onions, mustard seeds, turmeric powder, green chilies, curry leaves), and oil for cooking.
preparation: Prepare a batter using rice and urad dal (black gram dal), then ferment it overnight. Spread a ladleful of batter on a hot griddle to form a thin crepe. Add a layer of spicy potato filling, fold the dosa, and serve with coconut chutney and sambar.

ingredients: Ragi flour (finger millet flour) and water.
preparation: Bring water to a boil and gradually add ragi flour while stirring continuously to avoid lumps. Cook until the mixture thickens and forms a dense dough-like consistency. Shape the dough into balls and serve hot with sambar or chutney.

ingredients: Gram flour (besan), ghee, sugar, and cardamom powder.
preparation: Heat ghee in a pan and roast besan (gram flour) until fragrant. Add sugar and water to make a syrup, then mix in the roasted besan and cook until the mixture thickens. Pour the mixture into a greased tray, allow it to set, and cut into pieces before serving.

ingredients: Rice, water, and salt.
preparation: Prepare a batter using rice and coconut, then blend until smooth. Thin out the batter with water to make a runny consistency. Pour a ladleful of batter onto a hot griddle and spread it thinly. Cook until the edges start to lift, then fold and serve hot with chutney or curry.

ingredients: Semolina (rava or sooji), yogurt, water, eno (fruit salt), mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, green chilies, coriander leaves, and salt.
preparation: Roast semolina (rava) in ghee until lightly golden. Mix the roasted rava with yogurt, salt, and spices, then let it sit for a few minutes. Grease idli molds with oil, pour the batter into the molds, and steam until cooked through. Serve hot with sambar and chutney.

ingredients: Rice, eggplant (brinjal), tamarind paste, spices like mustard seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, cloves, cinnamon, curry leaves, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt.
preparation: Cook rice with chopped eggplant (brinjal), tamarind paste, and spices like mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and curry leaves. Prepare a spice paste with coconut, red chilies, and other spices, then mix it with the cooked rice. Garnish with fried cashews and serve hot.

ingredients: Rice, lemon juice, turmeric powder, mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, peanuts, green chilies, curry leaves, ginger, and salt.
preparation: Cook rice and temper with mustard seeds, urad dal, chilies, and curry leaves. Add turmeric, lemon juice, and salt for flavor. Mix well and garnish with chopped coriander leaves and grated coconut before serving.

ingredients: Toor dal (split pigeon peas), mixed vegetables (like drumsticks, potatoes, carrots, beans), tamarind paste, spices like mustard seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, curry leaves, red chili powder, turmeric powder, sambar powder, and salt.
preparation: Cook toor dal with vegetables like pumpkin, drumsticks, and tomatoes. Prepare a spice paste with coconut, coriander seeds, red chilies, and other spices, then mix it with the cooked dal and vegetables. Temper with mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves for added flavor.

ingredients: Wheat flour or all-purpose flour, chana dal (split chickpeas), jaggery (or sugar), cardamom powder, ghee, and water.
preparation: Prepare a dough using maida (all-purpose flour), water, and a pinch of salt. Roll out the dough into thin circles and stuff with a sweet filling made from jaggery, grated coconut, and cardamom powder. Fold the dough over the filling, seal the edges, and cook on a hot griddle until golden brown on both sides. Serve hot with ghee.

ingredients: For Appam - rice flour, coconut milk, sugar, yeast, and salt. For Stew - mixed vegetables (like potatoes, carrots, beans), coconut milk, onion, ginger, green chilies, curry leaves, coconut oil, and spices like turmeric powder and black pepper.
preparation: Prepare a batter using fermented rice flour, coconut milk, yeast, and sugar. Heat an appam pan, pour a ladleful of batter, and swirl to coat the pan. Cover and cook until the edges are crisp and the center is soft and fluffy. Serve hot with vegetable stew made from coconut milk, vegetables, and spices.

ingredients: For Puttu - rice flour, grated coconut, salt, and water. For Kadala Curry - black chickpeas (kadala), coconut milk, onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, green chilies, curry leaves, coconut oil, and spices like turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala.
preparation: Prepare puttu by layering rice flour and grated coconut in a cylindrical puttu maker, then steam until cooked through. For kadala curry, cook black chickpeas (kadala) with onions, tomatoes, coconut milk, and spices until tender and flavorful.

ingredients: Fish (like pomfret or kingfish), coconut milk, tamarind pulp, onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, green chilies, curry leaves, coconut oil, and spices like turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and fenugreek seeds.
preparation: Saute shallots, garlic, and ginger in coconut oil until fragrant. Add tomatoes, curry leaves, turmeric, red chili powder, and tamarind pulp, then cook until the mixture thickens. Add fish pieces, coconut milk, and salt, and simmer until the fish is cooked through.

ingredients: Mixed vegetables (like carrots, beans, potatoes, drumsticks), grated coconut, yogurt, green chilies, curry leaves, coconut oil, and turmeric powder.
preparation: Cook mixed vegetables like carrots, beans, potatoes, and pumpkin with turmeric, salt, and water until tender. Grind coconut, cumin seeds, green chilies, and curry leaves into a paste, then mix with the cooked vegetables. Tempering with coconut oil, mustard seeds, and curry leaves enhances the flavor.

ingredients: For Parotta - all-purpose flour, oil, salt, and water. For Chicken Curry - chicken pieces, coconut milk, onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, green chilies, curry leaves, coconut oil, and spices like turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala.
preparation: Prepare parotta dough using flour, water, salt, and oil. Roll out the dough into thin circles, then cook on a hot griddle until golden brown and flaky. Serve hot with chicken curry made from marinated chicken cooked with onions, tomatoes, coconut milk, and spices.

ingredients: For Puttu - rice flour, grated coconut, salt, and water. Served with sliced bananas and sugar.
preparation: Prepare puttu by layering rice flour and grated coconut in a cylindrical puttu maker, then steam until cooked through. Serve with sliced ripe bananas and a sprinkle of sugar for sweetness.

ingredients: Pearl spot fish (karimeen), ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric powder, lemon juice, curry leaves, coconut oil, and banana leaves for wrapping.
preparation: Marinate fish (typically pearl spot fish or karimeen) with a mixture of spices, ginger-garlic paste, and lemon juice. Wrap the marinated fish in banana leaves and steam or grill until cooked through.

ingredients: Beef, onions, ginger, garlic, green chilies, curry leaves, coconut oil, and spices like turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala.
preparation: Marinate beef pieces with spices, ginger-garlic paste, and vinegar. Sauté sliced onions, green chilies, curry leaves, and ginger-garlic paste until golden brown. Add the marinated beef and cook until tender and browned.

ingredients: Prawns, coconut milk, onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, green chilies, curry leaves, coconut oil, and spices like turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala.
preparation: Saute shallots, garlic, and ginger in coconut oil until fragrant. Add tomatoes, curry leaves, turmeric, red chili powder, and tamarind pulp, then cook until the mixture thickens. Add cleaned prawns, coconut milk, and salt, and simmer until the prawns are cooked through.

ingredients: Rice or vermicelli, milk, sugar, cardamom pods, saffron strands, and mixed nuts like cashews, almonds, and raisins.
preparation: Cook rice or vermicelli with milk, sugar, and cardamom until soft and creamy. Garnish with fried cashews, raisins, and grated coconut before serving. Traditional variants include palada payasam made with rice flakes or ada payasam made with rice pasta.

ingredients: Noodles, broth (usually chicken or vegetable), mixed vegetables (like carrots, cabbage, bell peppers), onions, garlic, ginger, chili paste, soy sauce, and cilantro for garnish.
preparation: Boil noodles in broth along with vegetables (such as carrots, cabbage, and spinach) and protein (such as chicken, beef, or tofu). Season with spices like garlic, ginger, and chili flakes. Serve hot as a hearty soup.

ingredients: For the dough - all-purpose flour, water, and salt. For the filling - minced meat (like chicken, pork, or beef) or vegetables, onions, garlic, ginger, green chilies, soy sauce, and spices like turmeric powder and cumin powder.
preparation: Prepare a dough using flour, water, and salt. Roll out the dough into thin circles, fill with a mixture of minced meat or vegetables seasoned with garlic, ginger, onions, and spices, and fold into a dumpling shape. Steam the momos until cooked through and serve with dipping sauce.

ingredients: Wheat flour, water, butter, mixed vegetables (like carrots, peas, potatoes), onions, garlic, ginger, chili paste, and spices like cumin seeds and coriander powder.
preparation: Prepare a dough using flour, water, and salt. Roll out the dough into thick noodles and cook them with vegetables, meat (such as lamb or yak), and spices like cumin and chili powder until the noodles are tender and the flavors meld.

ingredients: Hand-pulled noodles, broth (usually chicken or vegetable), mixed vegetables (like carrots, cabbage, spinach), onions, garlic, ginger, chili paste, soy sauce, and cilantro for garnish.
preparation: Prepare a dough using flour, water, and salt. Roll out the dough into thick noodles and cook them with vegetables, meat (such as beef or chicken), and spices like garlic and ginger until the noodles are tender and the flavors meld.

ingredients: Millet or barley grains, water, and yeast.
preparation: Ferment barley grains or flour with yeast to make a traditional Tibetan alcoholic beverage known as chhang. The fermented mixture is then strained and served cold or warm.

ingredients: A traditional dish of Ladakh, similar to a stew, made with mixed vegetables, meats, or lentils cooked in a savory broth.
preparation: Gutti is a traditional Tibetan dish made from dried yak cheese. The cheese is usually grated or crumbled and eaten as a snack or added to other dishes for flavor.

ingredients: Black tea leaves, water, butter, salt, and sometimes milk.
preparation: Brew black tea with water and salt, then add yak butter and sometimes milk. The tea is then churned until frothy, creating a rich and creamy beverage that provides warmth and energy in the cold Tibetan climate.

ingredients: Yak meat (such as yak steaks or yak curry) cooked with various spices and herbs, along with vegetables like potatoes and carrots.
preparation: Yak meat is often prepared in various ways, including stir-frying with vegetables, stewing in broth with spices and herbs, or grilling over an open flame. The meat is known for its lean texture and rich flavor.

ingredients: Rice, milk, sugar, saffron strands, cardamom powder, and mixed nuts like almonds and pistachios for garnish.
preparation: Cook rice with milk, sugar, and cardamom until the mixture thickens. Pour the mixture into serving bowls and allow it to cool and set. Garnish with chopped nuts and serve chilled as a dessert.

ingredients: A traditional cheese made from yak milk, often used in cooking or consumed as a snack.
preparation: Chhurpi is a traditional Tibetan cheese made from yak milk. It can be consumed fresh as a soft cheese or dried and hardened into a chewy snack.

ingredients: Flattened rice (poha), mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, onions, potatoes, peanuts, turmeric powder, lemon juice, coriander leaves, and salt.
preparation: Rinse flattened rice (poha) and drain excess water. Heat oil in a pan and temper with mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies. Add chopped onions, potatoes, and peanuts, then sauté until cooked through. Mix in the soaked poha, turmeric, salt, and sugar. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot.

ingredients: For Dal - pigeon peas (toor dal), water, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, onions, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and salt. For Bafla - wheat flour, ghee, salt, and water.
preparation: Prepare a dough using wheat flour, salt, and water. Shape the dough into small balls and boil them in water until they float. Drain and bake the boiled dough balls until golden brown and cooked through. Serve with dal prepared from lentils tempered with spices and ghee.

ingredients: Grated corn kernels, milk, green chilies, ginger, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, lemon juice, coriander leaves, and salt.
preparation: Grate corn kernels and sauté them in ghee with mustard seeds, green chilies, ginger, and spices until cooked through. Finish with a splash of milk, lemon juice, and fresh coriander leaves.

ingredients: For Poha - flattened rice (poha), mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, onions, potatoes, peanuts, turmeric powder, lemon juice, coriander leaves, and salt. For Jalebi - all-purpose flour, yogurt, sugar, saffron, water, and oil for frying.
preparation: Prepare poha as described earlier. Serve hot with jalebi, a sweet made from fermented batter deep-fried and soaked in sugar syrup. This combination is a popular street food in Indore.

ingredients: Lamb or goat meat, yogurt, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, spices like cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, bay leaves, red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and garam masala.
preparation: Marinate goat meat with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. Sauté sliced onions until golden brown, then add the marinated meat and cook until tender. Add a paste made from cashews, almonds, and poppy seeds along with cream and cook until the gravy thickens.

ingredients: Freshly squeezed lemon juice, Water, Sugar or sugar syrup, Black salt (kala namak), Roasted cumin powder, Ground ginger (optional), Mint leaves (optional), Soda water (optional, for extra fizz)
preparation: Mix together lemon juice, water, sugar, salt, roasted cumin powder, and black pepper powder to make a refreshing lemonade. Serve chilled with ice cubes and garnish with mint leaves.

ingredients: All-purpose flour, milk, sugar, fennel seeds, cardamom powder, and oil or ghee for frying.
preparation: Prepare a batter using flour, milk, sugar, and mashed bananas or grated coconut. Heat ghee in a pan, pour spoonfuls of batter, and fry until golden brown and crispy. Soak the fried malpuas in sugar syrup until they absorb the sweetness.

ingredients: Wheat flour, ghee, salt, and water.
preparation: Bafla is a dough ball made from wheat flour, ghee, salt, and water. It is boiled until cooked through and then baked until golden brown. Bafla is often served with dal or chutney.

ingredients: Minced meat (usually lamb or chicken), onions, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, coriander leaves, spices like cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt.
preparation: Mix minced meat (usually lamb or chicken) with spices, herbs, and sometimes grated onions and green chilies. Shape the mixture onto skewers and grill or roast until cooked through and charred on the outside.

ingredients: For Bati - wheat flour, semolina (sooji), ghee, yogurt, salt, and water. For Mawa - milk, sugar, and ghee.
preparation: Prepare a dough using flour, ghee, milk, and crumbled mawa (reduced milk solids). Shape the dough into small balls and deep fry until golden brown. Serve hot with sugar syrup or rabri (sweetened condensed milk).

ingredients: For Vada - potatoes, gram flour (besan), ginger, garlic, green chilies, turmeric powder, mustard seeds, curry leaves, coriander leaves, and oil for frying. For Pav - bread rolls (pav), butter, and garlic chutney.
preparation: Prepare a spicy potato filling by mashing boiled potatoes and mixing them with green chilies, ginger, garlic, turmeric, mustard seeds, and curry leaves. Shape the mixture into balls, coat with gram flour batter, and deep fry until golden brown. Serve the vadas inside pav (soft bread rolls) along with green chutney and tamarind chutney.

ingredients: Potatoes, mixed vegetables (like cauliflower, peas, carrots), tomatoes, onions, capsicum (bell peppers), ginger-garlic paste, pav bhaji masala, butter, and bread rolls (pav).
preparation: Cook a mixture of mashed vegetables (such as potatoes, peas, carrots, and cauliflower) with tomatoes, onions, ginger-garlic paste, and pav bhaji masala. Mash the cooked vegetables until smooth and serve with buttered pav (bread rolls), chopped onions, and lemon wedges.

ingredients: Mixed sprouts (like moth beans, mung beans), onions, tomatoes, potatoes, mixed spices, tamarind paste, lemon juice, farsan (fried savory snack), and bread rolls (pav).
preparation: Cook sprouted lentils (usually moth beans) with onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. Serve the cooked misal with pav (bread rolls) and garnish with chopped onions, coriander leaves, farsan (crispy snack mix), and lemon wedges.

ingredients: For Puran - chana dal (split chickpeas), jaggery (or sugar), cardamom powder, and ghee. For Poli - whole wheat flour, oil, and water.
preparation: Prepare a dough using flour, water, and oil. Roll out the dough into circles and stuff with a sweet filling made from cooked split chickpeas (chana dal), jaggery, cardamom, and nutmeg. Roll out the stuffed dough into thin discs and cook on a griddle with ghee until golden brown.

ingredients: Potatoes, gram flour (besan), ginger, garlic, green chilies, turmeric powder, mustard seeds, curry leaves, coriander leaves, and oil for frying.
preparation: Prepare a spicy potato filling by mashing boiled potatoes and mixing them with green chilies, ginger, garlic, turmeric, mustard seeds, and curry leaves. Shape the mixture into balls, coat with gram flour batter, and deep fry until golden brown. Serve hot with green chutney and tamarind chutney.

ingredients: Rice flour, jaggery (or sugar), grated coconut, cardamom powder, and ghee.
preparation: Prepare a dough using rice flour and water. Fill the dough with a sweet coconut and jaggery mixture flavored with cardamom and nutmeg. Shape the filled dough into dumplings and steam until cooked through. Serve hot as a sweet treat.

ingredients: Small eggplants, grated coconut, peanuts, sesame seeds, tamarind pulp, jaggery (or sugar), and spices like coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, and turmeric powder.
preparation: Stuff baby eggplants with a spicy coconut and peanut mixture flavored with tamarind, jaggery, and spices. Cook the stuffed eggplants in a coconut-based gravy until tender and flavorful.

ingredients: Mixed sprouts (like moth beans, mung beans), onions, tomatoes, potatoes, mixed spices, tamarind paste, lemon juice, farsan (fried savory snack), and bread rolls (pav).
preparation: Cook sprouted lentils (usually moth beans) with onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and Kolhapuri misal masala (a spicy blend of spices). Serve the cooked misal with pav (bread rolls) and garnish with chopped onions, coriander leaves, farsan (crispy snack mix), and lemon wedges.

ingredients: Sabudana (tapioca pearls), peanuts, potatoes, green chilies, cumin seeds, curry leaves, lemon juice, and salt.
preparation: Soak sabudana (tapioca pearls) until soft, then sauté with crushed peanuts, green chilies, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with yogurt.

ingredients: Coconut milk, kokum (dried mangosteen), green chilies, ginger, garlic, and spices like cumin seeds and asafoetida.
preparation: Prepare a drink using kokum (dried mangosteen rind), coconut milk, water, green chilies, and salt. Serve chilled as a refreshing beverage, often consumed after spicy meals to aid digestion.

ingredients: Boiled vegetables (like potatoes, yam, and pumpkin), fermented fish (ngari), chili paste, garlic, ginger, salt, and water.
preparation: Eromba is a traditional Manipuri dish made with mashed boiled vegetables (usually potatoes or yam) mixed with fermented fish (ngari), chili, and other spices. The mixture is then cooked with water to create a thick stew-like consistency.

ingredients: Assorted vegetables (like cabbage, beans, carrots), bamboo shoots, ginger, green chilies, salt, and water.
preparation: Chamthong is a Manipuri vegetable stew prepared by boiling mixed seasonal vegetables (such as pumpkins, beans, bamboo shoots, and potatoes) with ngari (fermented fish), ginger, garlic, and green chilies. It is seasoned with salt and sometimes turmeric.

ingredients: Fermented fish, salt, and water.
preparation: Ngari is a fermented fish paste commonly used in Manipuri cuisine. It is made by fermenting small freshwater fish with salt for several months until it develops a strong aroma and flavor. Ngari is often used as a condiment or flavoring agent in various dishes.

ingredients: Freshwater fish (often using rohu or catfish), flavored with ginger, garlic, green chili peppers, and seasoned with turmeric and other spices. Coconut milk is often used to give it a creamy texture, and sometimes fermented fish (ngari) is also added for additional flavor.
preparation: Nga Thongba is a Manipuri fish curry made with fish (often catfish) cooked in a flavorful broth of ngari (fermented fish), ginger, garlic, green chilies, and other spices. Coconut milk is sometimes added to create a creamy texture.

ingredients: Black rice (chak-hao), milk, sugar, cardamom pods, and nuts like cashews and almonds.
preparation: Chak-Hao Kheer is a traditional Manipuri dessert made with black rice (chak-hao) cooked in milk with sugar and sometimes flavored with cardamom, saffron, or rose water. It is simmered until the rice is soft and the mixture thickens into a creamy pudding-like consistency.

ingredients: Paneer (Indian cottage cheese), potatoes, tomatoes, onions, ginger, garlic, green chilies, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, salt, and water.
preparation: Sana Thongba is a Manipuri vegetarian dish made with paneer or tofu cooked in a flavorful broth of milk, ngari (fermented fish), ginger, garlic, and green chilies. It is seasoned with salt and sometimes turmeric.
