ingredients: Assorted vegetables (like cabbage, carrots, radishes), lotus stem, ginger, green chilies, mustard oil, salt, and water.
preparation: Singju is a traditional Manipuri salad made with finely shredded seasonal vegetables (such as cabbage, carrots, radishes, and lotus stems) mixed with roasted chickpea powder, ngari (fermented fish), green chilies, and other spices. It is typically served as a side dish or appetizer.

ingredients: Rice flour, water, sugar, cardamom pods, and coconut milk.
preparation: Paaknam is a Manipuri dish made with roasted or steamed sticky rice mixed with ngari (fermented fish), chili, and other spices. The mixture is then formed into small balls or cakes and eaten as a snack or side dish.

ingredients: Banana flowers, chickpeas, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, salt, and water.
preparation: Kelli Chana is a Manipuri dish made with boiled chickpeas (chana) cooked in a spicy tomato-based gravy with onions, garlic, ginger, and green chilies. It is seasoned with spices like cumin, coriander, and turmeric.

ingredients: Green chilies, garlic, ginger, salt, and mustard oil.
preparation: Morok Metpa is a spicy chili paste made with roasted or grilled green chilies (morok) mixed with ngari (fermented fish), garlic, salt, and sometimes other spices. It is commonly used as a condiment or flavoring agent in Manipuri cuisine.

ingredients: Rice, pork or chicken, onions, ginger, garlic, turmeric powder, black pepper, salt, and oil.
preparation: Jadoh is a traditional Khasi rice dish cooked with meat (usually pork or chicken), onions, ginger, turmeric, and local spices. The rice is often seasoned with black sesame seeds and served with a side of spicy chutney.

ingredients: Pork or chicken, black sesame seeds, ginger, garlic, onions, green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and oil.
preparation: Doh-neiiong is a Meghalayan pork curry prepared with pork meat, black sesame seeds, ginger, garlic, onions, and a variety of local spices. The dish is slow-cooked until the pork is tender and the flavors are well-developed.

ingredients: Rice flour, water, sugar, and grated coconut.
preparation: Pumaloi is a traditional Meghalayan steamed rice cake made with rice flour, jaggery (or sugar), grated coconut, and cardamom. The mixture is steamed until cooked through and served as a sweet snack or dessert.

ingredients: Pork, onions, ginger, garlic, black sesame seeds, green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and oil.
preparation: Dohkhlieh is a traditional Khasi salad made with finely shredded pork, onions, green chilies, ginger, and lime juice. The ingredients are mixed together and seasoned with salt and pepper, then served as a refreshing appetizer.

ingredients: Fermented soybeans or black grams, ginger, garlic, onions, green chilies, turmeric powder, and salt.
preparation: Tungrymbai is a traditional fermented soybean paste dish made with black soybeans, ginger, garlic, and local herbs and spices. The mixture is fermented for several days to develop its characteristic flavor, then cooked with pork or vegetables.

ingredients: Rice flour, jaggery or sugar, grated coconut, and water.
preparation: Pukhlein is a traditional Meghalayan rice flour pancake made with rice flour, jaggery (or sugar), grated coconut, and cardamom. The mixture is fried until golden brown and crispy, then served as a sweet snack or dessert.

ingredients: Pork or beef, onions, ginger, garlic, black sesame seeds, green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and oil.
preparation: Soh-phlang is a traditional Khasi soup made with pork meat, black sesame seeds, ginger, garlic, onions, and local herbs and spices. The soup is slow-cooked until the pork is tender and the flavors are well-developed.

ingredients: Rice flour, jaggery or sugar, grated coconut, and water.
preparation: Sakkin Gata is a traditional Meghalayan dessert made with sticky rice, jaggery (or sugar), grated coconut, and cardamom. The mixture is steamed until cooked through and served as a sweet treat.

ingredients: Rice flour, black sesame seeds, jaggery or sugar, and water.
preparation: Pudoh is a traditional Meghalayan steamed rice cake made with rice flour, jaggery (or sugar), grated coconut, and cardamom. The mixture is steamed until cooked through and served as a sweet snack or dessert.

ingredients: Pork, onions, ginger, garlic, black sesame seeds, green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and oil.
preparation: Doh-sniang is a traditional Meghalayan pork stew prepared with pork meat, black sesame seeds, ginger, garlic, onions, and a variety of local spices. The stew is slow-cooked until the pork is tender and the flavors are well-developed.

ingredients: Pork or chicken, bamboo shoots, ginger, garlic, onions, green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and oil.
preparation: Bai is a traditional Mizoram dish made with vegetables (such as spinach, mustard greens, or pumpkin) cooked in a gravy of mustard paste, red chili paste, and fermented bamboo shoot juice. It is often served with rice.

ingredients: Rice flour, jaggery or sugar, grated coconut, and water.
preparation: Zawlaidi is a traditional Mizoram dish made with pork cooked in a spicy gravy of ginger, garlic, onions, and local spices. It is typically served with rice or bread.

ingredients: Pork or chicken, bamboo shoots, ginger, garlic, onions, green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and oil.
preparation: Baih is a traditional Mizoram dish made with dried fish (usually small fish like anchovies) cooked in a spicy gravy of ginger, garlic, onions, and local spices. It is often served with rice or bread.

ingredients: Pork or chicken, bamboo shoots, ginger, garlic, onions, green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and oil.
preparation: Sawhchiar is a traditional Mizoram dish made with smoked or grilled meat (such as pork or chicken) served with a spicy chutney made from red chilies, garlic, ginger, and local herbs.

ingredients: Rice flour, jaggery or sugar, grated coconut, and water.
preparation: Arsa Buhchiar is a traditional Mizoram sweet dish made with rice flour, jaggery (or sugar), grated coconut, and cardamom. The mixture is steamed until cooked through and served as a sweet snack or dessert.

ingredients: Fish, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, turmeric powder, mustard oil, and spices like cumin seeds and coriander powder.
preparation: Misa Mach Poora is a traditional Mizoram fish dish made with small fish (usually anchovies or sardines) marinated in a mixture of turmeric, red chili powder, garlic, ginger, and lemon juice, then pan-fried until crispy.

ingredients: Millet or barley grains, water, and yeast.
preparation: Chhangban is a traditional Mizoram dish made with pork cooked in a spicy gravy of ginger, garlic, onions, and local spices. It is typically served with rice or bread.

ingredients: Rice flour, jaggery or sugar, grated coconut, and water.
preparation: Koat Pitha is a traditional Mizoram snack made with rice flour, jaggery (or sugar), grated coconut, and cardamom. The mixture is deep-fried until golden brown and crispy, then served as a sweet snack.

ingredients: Assorted vegetables (like potatoes, cauliflower, carrots), mustard oil, panch phoron (a mix of five whole spices - fenugreek seeds, nigella seeds, cumin seeds, black mustard seeds, and fennel seeds), ginger, garlic, green chilies, turmeric powder, and salt.
preparation: Panch Phoron Tarkari is a traditional Mizoram vegetable curry made with a blend of five spices (panch phoron), mixed vegetables, tomatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, and turmeric. It is typically served with rice or bread.

ingredients: Assorted vegetables (like cabbage, beans, carrots), bamboo shoots, ginger, green chilies, salt, and water.
preparation: Chamthong is a traditional Mizoram vegetable stew prepared by boiling mixed seasonal vegetables (such as pumpkins, beans, bamboo shoots, and potatoes) with smoked or grilled meat (such as pork or chicken), ginger, garlic, and local spices. It is seasoned with salt and sometimes turmeric.

ingredients: Smoked pork, bamboo shoots, ginger, garlic, onions, green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and oil.
preparation: Marinate pork meat with salt and local spices, then smoke it over a wood fire until cooked and infused with smoky flavor. Cook the smoked pork with bamboo shoots, ginger, garlic, green chilies, and other spices until tender and flavorful.

ingredients: Fermented soybeans, water, salt, and spices like ginger, garlic, and green chilies.
preparation: Axone is made by fermenting soybeans with salt and water for several days until they develop a pungent aroma and tangy flavor. It is commonly used as a condiment or flavoring agent in Naga cuisine.

ingredients: Pork, ghost peppers (bhut jolokia), ginger, garlic, onions, tomatoes, turmeric powder, salt, and oil.
preparation: Marinate pork meat with salt, ginger, garlic, and local spices. Cook the marinated pork with onions, tomatoes, and ghost peppers (bhut jolokia) until the meat is tender and the curry is rich and spicy.

ingredients: Fish, bamboo shoots, ginger, garlic, onions, green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and oil.
preparation: Marinate fish with salt, turmeric, ginger, garlic, and green chilies. Stuff the fish into bamboo tubes along with herbs and spices, then steam until cooked through. The bamboo imparts a unique flavor to the fish.

ingredients: Smoked pork, akhuni (fermented soybean paste), ginger, garlic, onions, green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and oil.
preparation: Marinate pork meat with salt and local spices, then smoke it over a wood fire until cooked and infused with smoky flavor. Cook the smoked pork with akhuni (fermented soybean) paste, ginger, garlic, green chilies, and other spices until tender and flavorful.

ingredients: King chilies (bhut jolokia or raja mircha), tomatoes, garlic, ginger, vinegar, salt, and sugar.
preparation: Blend roasted king chilies (raja mircha) with garlic, ginger, salt, and vinegar until smooth to make a fiery chutney. This chutney adds heat and flavor to various Naga dishes.

ingredients: Chicken, ginger, garlic, onions, tomatoes, green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and oil.
preparation: Marinate chicken pieces with salt, turmeric, ginger, garlic, and local spices. Cook the marinated chicken with onions, tomatoes, and green chilies until the meat is tender and the curry is rich and flavorful.

ingredients: Rice, mixed vegetables (like potatoes, beans, carrots), ginger, garlic, green chilies, salt, and water.
preparation: Galho is a traditional Naga rice soup made by boiling rice with meat (usually pork or chicken), vegetables, and local herbs and spices. It is seasoned with salt and sometimes fermented bamboo shoots for added flavor.

ingredients: Smoked beef, akhuni (fermented soybean paste), ginger, garlic, onions, green chilies, turmeric powder, salt, and oil.
preparation: Marinate beef with salt and local spices, then smoke it over a wood fire until cooked and infused with smoky flavor. Cook the smoked beef with akhuni (fermented soybean) paste, ginger, garlic, green chilies, and other spices until tender and flavorful.

ingredients: Fish, ginger, garlic, turmeric powder, red chili powder, salt, and oil.
preparation: Marinate fish with salt, turmeric, ginger, garlic, and local spices. Coat the marinated fish with rice flour or chickpea flour and shallow or deep fry until crispy and golden brown. Serve hot as a flavorful and crunchy snack or side dish.

ingredients: Fermented rice (pakhala), water, salt, and toppings like fried or boiled vegetables, fried fish, or pickles.
preparation: Pakhala Bhata is a traditional Odia dish made by fermenting cooked rice in water overnight. The fermented rice is then seasoned with salt and served with sides like fried or mashed vegetables, fried fish, or pickles.

ingredients: Pigeon peas (arhar dal), mixed vegetables (like pumpkin, raw banana, papaya), ginger, garlic, green chilies, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, and salt.
preparation: Dalma is a traditional Odia lentil and vegetable stew made with pigeon peas (arhar dal) cooked with assorted vegetables like pumpkin, potatoes, and plantains. It is seasoned with mustard oil, ginger, garlic, and panch phoron (five spice blend) for flavor.

ingredients: Cottage cheese (chhena), sugar, semolina (sooji), ghee, cardamom powder, and nuts like cashews and almonds.
preparation: Chhena Poda is a popular Odia dessert made with fresh cottage cheese (chhena), sugar, cardamom, and ghee. The mixture is baked until golden brown, resulting in a caramelized crust with a soft and moist interior.

ingredients: Fish, mustard seeds, mustard oil, ginger, garlic, onions, tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
preparation: Machha Besara is a traditional Odia fish curry made with fish (usually freshwater fish like rohu or catla) cooked in a mustard-based gravy. The gravy is flavored with mustard paste, turmeric, ginger, garlic, and spices.

ingredients: Mixed vegetables (like potatoes, pumpkin, eggplant), ginger, garlic, green chilies, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, and salt.
preparation: Santula is a traditional Odia mixed vegetable dish made by lightly sautéing vegetables like potatoes, pumpkin, eggplant, and tomatoes in mustard oil. It is flavored with mustard seeds, cumin seeds, ginger, garlic, and turmeric.

ingredients: Cottage cheese (chhena), sugar, water, and rose water or cardamom for flavoring.
preparation: Rasagola is a classic Odia dessert made with cottage cheese (chhena) balls cooked in sugar syrup flavored with cardamom or saffron. The chhena balls are soft, spongy, and soaked in the sweet syrup.

ingredients: Prawns, mustard seeds, mustard oil, ginger, garlic, onions, tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
preparation: Chingudi Jhola is a traditional Odia prawn curry made with prawns cooked in a spicy gravy of onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, turmeric, and spices. It is typically served with rice or roti.

ingredients: All-purpose flour, ghee or oil, sugar, water, and cardamom powder.
preparation: Khaja is a crispy and flaky sweet snack from Odisha made with flour, ghee, sugar, and cardamom. The dough is rolled out, layered with ghee, folded, and fried until golden brown. It is then soaked in sugar syrup for sweetness.

ingredients: For Puri - wheat flour, water, salt, and oil for frying. For Bhaji - potatoes, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, turmeric powder, cumin seeds, mustard seeds, curry leaves, and coriander leaves.
preparation: Puri Bhaji is a popular Odia breakfast dish consisting of deep-fried bread (puri) served with a spicy potato curry (bhaji). The potatoes are cooked with onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, and spices for a flavorful curry.

ingredients: Spinach leaves, oil for frying, and spices like turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.
preparation: Saga Bhaja is a traditional Odia side dish made by stir-frying leafy greens (such as spinach, amaranth, or mustard greens) with mustard oil, garlic, green chilies, and spices until wilted and tender. It is a nutritious and flavorful accompaniment to rice or roti.

itemName: Sarson da Saag and Makki di Roti
ingredients: For Sarson da Saag - mustard greens (sarson), spinach, bathua (chenopodium), ginger, garlic, green chilies, onions, tomatoes, ghee or butter, and spices like turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. For Makki di Roti - maize flour (makki ka atta), water, and salt.
preparation: Boil mustard greens, spinach, and other greens until tender. Finely chop and saute them with onions, garlic, ginger, green chilies, and spices like cumin, coriander, and garam masala. For Makki di Roti, knead maize flour with water into a dough, then roll out into flatbreads and cook on a hot griddle until golden brown.

ingredients: Chicken, yogurt, tomatoes, cream, butter, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, cashew nuts, spices like garam masala, turmeric powder, and red chili powder.
preparation: Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. Grill or roast until cooked. For the sauce, blend cooked tomatoes, onions, and cashews. In a pan, heat butter, add the tomato paste, cream, and chicken pieces, simmer until flavors meld together.

ingredients: For Chole - chickpeas, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, spices like cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and dried mango powder (amchur). For Bhature - all-purpose flour, yogurt, baking powder, sugar, salt, and oil for frying.
preparation: Soak chickpeas overnight, then cook with onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, and spices until tender. For bhature, knead dough using flour, yogurt, a pinch of baking powder, and salt. Roll out into discs and deep fry until puffed and golden.

ingredients: Chicken, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, spices like garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and orange-red food color.
preparation: Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, and red food color. Skewer and cook in a preheated tandoor until fully cooked and charred.

ingredients: Paneer (Indian cottage cheese), yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, spices like garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves).
preparation: Marinate paneer cubes with bell peppers, onions, and tomatoes in a mixture of yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, and lemon juice. Thread onto skewers and grill until lightly charred.

ingredients: For Kadhi - yogurt, besan (gram flour), ginger, garlic, green chilies, curry leaves, turmeric powder, and spices like cumin seeds, mustard seeds, and fenugreek seeds. For Pakora - besan, onions, spinach, baking soda, and spices.
preparation: Whisk yogurt with gram flour, cook with spices until thickened. Meanwhile, prepare pakoras by mixing gram flour with water, chopped onions, green chilies, and spices, then deep fry until golden brown. Add the pakoras to the kadhi and simmer.

itemName: Aloo Paratha with Curd and Pickle
ingredients: For Aloo Paratha - whole wheat flour, potatoes, ginger, green chilies, spices like cumin powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. For Curd - yogurt. For Pickle - mixed vegetables (like mangoes or carrots), vinegar, sugar, salt, and spices.
preparation: Make a dough using whole wheat flour, water, and salt. For the stuffing, mash boiled potatoes and mix with spices. Roll out a dough ball, place stuffing, seal, and roll out again. Cook on a hot griddle with ghee until golden brown. Serve with curd and pickle.

ingredients: Fish fillets, besan (gram flour), ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, spices like garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and ajwain (carom seeds).
preparation: Marinate fish fillets in a mixture of gram flour, rice flour, ajwain, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, and spices. Deep fry until crispy and golden brown.

ingredients: Yogurt, water, sugar, and optionally, flavors like cardamom or rose water.
preparation: Blend yogurt with water until smooth. Add sugar, cardamom powder, and any desired flavorings like rose water or saffron strands. Blend again until well combined. Serve chilled, optionally garnished with chopped nuts or ground cardamom.

ingredients: Kidney beans, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, spices like cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and dried mango powder (amchur).
preparation: Soak kidney beans overnight, then cook until tender. Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until golden brown, then add tomatoes and cook until softened. Add spices like cumin, coriander, chili powder, and garam masala. Add cooked kidney beans along with water and simmer until flavors meld together and the curry thickens. Serve hot.

ingredients: For Dal - Pigeon peas (toor dal), onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, and salt. For Baati - Whole wheat flour, semolina (sooji), ghee, yogurt, and salt. For Churma - Whole wheat flour, ghee, jaggery (or sugar), and nuts like almonds and pistachios.
preparation: For Dal, cook lentils with spices until tender. For Baati, mix wheat flour, semolina, ghee, and water to form a stiff dough. Shape into balls and bake until golden brown. Crush the baatis and mix with ghee and sugar to make Churma.

ingredients: Lamb or mutton, yogurt, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and ghee.
preparation: Marinate mutton with yogurt, garlic, ginger, chili powder, and spices. Cook with onions, tomatoes, and more spices until tender and the gravy thickens.

ingredients: Chickpea flour (besan), yogurt, ginger, garlic, green chilies, turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and tomatoes.
preparation: Mix chickpea flour with spices, knead into a dough, and shape into cylindrical rolls. Cook these in boiling water until firm. Cut into pieces and cook in a yogurt-based gravy with spices.

ingredients: Ker (Indian caper) berries, sangri (dried beans of the Khejri tree), mustard oil, spices like cumin seeds, coriander powder, red chili powder, and turmeric powder.
preparation: Soak dried ker and sangri overnight. Boil them until tender. Then, temper with spices like cumin, mustard seeds, red chili powder, and cook until flavors meld together.

ingredients: Green chilies, gram flour (besan), potatoes, ginger, garlic, coriander leaves, spices like turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala.
preparation: Slit green chilies, remove seeds, stuff with a spicy potato mixture, dip in gram flour batter, and deep fry until crispy and golden brown.

ingredients: All-purpose flour, ghee, sugar, milk, and optionally, saffron and nuts like almonds and pistachios.
preparation: Prepare a batter with flour, ghee, and water. Pour this batter in concentric circles in hot ghee and fry until golden and crispy. Soak in sugar syrup and garnish with nuts.

itemName: Bajre ki Roti with Lehsun ki Chutney
ingredients: Pearl millet flour (bajra), water, and salt for Roti. For Lehsun ki Chutney - Garlic, green chilies, lemon juice, salt, and oil.
preparation: Knead bajra flour with water, roll out into discs, and cook on a griddle until cooked through. For the chutney, blend garlic cloves, green chilies, salt, and lemon juice until smooth.

ingredients: For Kachori - All-purpose flour, onions, spices like fennel seeds, coriander powder, and garam masala, and oil for frying.
preparation: Prepare a dough with flour, ghee, and water. Stuff with a mixture of onions, spices, and optionally, moong dal.Deep fry until golden brown and crispy.

ingredients: For Dal - Pigeon peas (toor dal), onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, and salt. For Pithi - Whole wheat flour, ghee, yogurt, and salt.
preparation: Make small balls of dough with wheat flour and stuffed with a mixture of lentils, spices, and sometimes vegetables. Boil these in water until cooked through. Serve with dal.

ingredients: For Kachori - All-purpose flour, ghee, baking powder, milk, and oil for frying. For Mawa filling - Mawa (khoya), sugar, and nuts like almonds and pistachios.
preparation: Prepare a dough with flour, ghee, and water. Stuff with a mixture of mawa (khoya), nuts, and sugar. Deep fry until golden brown and crispy. Serve garnished with powdered sugar or sugar syrup.

ingredients: For the dough - all-purpose flour, water, and salt. For the filling - minced meat (like chicken, pork, or beef) or vegetables, onions, garlic, ginger, green chilies, soy sauce, and spices like turmeric powder and cumin powder.
preparation: Prepare a dough with flour, water, and a pinch of salt. Roll out into thin circles. Fill each circle with a mixture of minced meat or vegetables seasoned with garlic, ginger, onions, and spices. Fold the dough over the filling to create dumplings, then steam until cooked through.

ingredients: Noodles, broth (usually chicken or vegetable), mixed vegetables (like carrots, cabbage, bell peppers), onions, garlic, ginger, chili paste, soy sauce, and cilantro for garnish.
preparation: Cook noodles in boiling water until al dente. In a separate pot, simmer a broth made with vegetables, meat, or tofu along with garlic, ginger, onions, and spices. Combine the cooked noodles with the broth and serve hot.

ingredients: Fermented leafy green vegetables (usually mustard greens or spinach), salt, and water.
preparation: Ferment leafy green vegetables such as mustard greens or spinach by packing them tightly in a container with salt and allowing them to ferment for several days. Once fermented, sun-dry the vegetables until completely dried. It can be used in various dishes as a flavor enhancer.

ingredients: Pork belly or pork meat, radishes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, soy sauce, and spices like turmeric powder and Sichuan pepper.
preparation: Cut pork into thin strips and marinate with soy sauce, ginger, garlic, and spices. Cook the marinated pork along with radishes and dried chilies until the meat is tender and the flavors meld together.

ingredients: Rice flour, sugar, cardamom powder, ghee or oil, and water.
preparation: Prepare a batter with rice flour, water, sugar, and spices. Heat oil in a pan and pour a small portion of the batter into the hot oil in a circular motion. Fry until golden brown and crispy.

ingredients: A traditional cheese made from yak milk, often used in cooking or consumed as a snack.
preparation: This is a type of cheese made from yak milk. The milk is heated, curdled, and then strained to separate the curds from the whey. The curds are pressed and dried to form a hard cheese, which can be consumed directly or used in various dishes.

ingredients: Fermented soybeans, water, salt, and sometimes spices like ginger and garlic.
preparation: Soak soybeans overnight, then boil until soft. Allow the soybeans to ferment naturally for a few days until they develop a strong aroma and a slightly sour taste. Kinema is typically consumed as a side dish or added to stews and soups.

ingredients: Hand-pulled noodles, broth (usually chicken or vegetable), mixed vegetables (like carrots, cabbage, spinach), onions, garlic, ginger, chili paste, soy sauce, and cilantro for garnish.
preparation: Prepare a broth with meat, vegetables, garlic, ginger, onions, and spices. Cook noodles separately until al dente. Combine the cooked noodles with the broth and serve hot.

ingredients: Fermented millet or barley beer.
preparation: Prepare a fermented alcoholic beverage made from barley, millet, or rice. The grains are soaked, boiled, mashed, fermented, and then strained to produce a clear, slightly sour-tasting drink. It's commonly consumed during festivals and special occasions.

ingredients: Grilled or roasted meat (usually chicken or buffalo), onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, spices like cumin powder, coriander powder, and chili powder, and mustard oil.
preparation: Marinate pieces of meat (usually chicken or lamb) with spices like turmeric, cumin, coriander, ginger, garlic, and chili powder. Grill or roast the marinated meat until cooked through and slightly charred. Serve hot as an appetizer or snack.

ingredients: Rice, urad dal (split black gram), fenugreek seeds, water, and salt.
preparation: Soak rice and urad dal separately for a few hours, then grind into a smooth batter. Ferment the batter overnight. Heat a griddle, pour a ladleful of batter, spread it thin, drizzle oil, and cook until crispy and golden brown. Serve hot with chutney and sambar.

ingredients: Toor dal (split pigeon peas), mixed vegetables (like carrots, potatoes, beans), tamarind paste, spices like mustard seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, curry leaves, red chili powder, turmeric powder, sambar powder, and salt.
preparation: Cook pigeon peas (toor dal) with vegetables like drumsticks, carrots, tomatoes, onions, and tamarind pulp. Temper mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, and dry red chilies in oil, then add to the cooked dal and vegetables. Season with sambar powder and salt.

ingredients: Rice, moong dal (split mung beans), ginger, black pepper, cumin seeds, ghee, and salt.
preparation: Cook rice and moong dal together until soft and mushy. In a separate pan, temper mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, ginger, and black pepper in ghee or oil. Add this tempering to the cooked rice and dal mixture. Season with salt and garnish with chopped coriander leaves.

ingredients: For Dosa - Rice, urad dal (split black gram), fenugreek seeds, water, and salt. For Masala - Potatoes, onions, green chilies, mustard seeds, turmeric powder, curry leaves, and salt.
preparation: Prepare dosa batter as mentioned earlier. For the masala filling, sauté onions, potatoes, green chilies, ginger, and spices like turmeric, mustard seeds, and curry leaves. Spread the filling on the dosa, fold, and serve with chutney and sambar.

ingredients: Rice, grated coconut, sugar, yeast, and salt.
preparation: Soak rice and grated coconut for a few hours, then grind into a smooth batter. Ferment the batter overnight. Heat an appam pan, pour a ladleful of batter, swirl the pan to spread the batter thin around the edges and thicker in the center, cover, and cook until the edges are crispy and the center is soft and fluffy.

ingredients: Rice, urad dal (split black gram), fenugreek seeds, water, and salt.
preparation: Soak rice and urad dal separately for a few hours, then grind into a smooth batter. Ferment the batter overnight. Pour the batter into greased idli molds and steam until cooked through. Serve hot with chutney and sambar.

ingredients: Tamarind pulp, tomatoes, spices like mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chilies, curry leaves, turmeric powder, black pepper, and salt.
preparation: Cook tomatoes, tamarind pulp, garlic, rasam powder, turmeric, and salt in water until the tomatoes are soft. Temper mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, and dry red chilies in ghee or oil, then add to the cooked tomato mixture. Garnish with coriander leaves.

ingredients: Basmati rice, chicken or meat, onions, tomatoes, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices like cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, bay leaves, red chili powder, turmeric powder, saffron, and nuts like cashews and raisins.
preparation: Marinate meat (chicken, mutton, or beef) with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices, and herbs. Parboil rice and layer it with the marinated meat in a heavy-bottomed pot. Add saffron-infused milk, fried onions, and chopped mint and coriander leaves. Cover and cook on low heat until the meat is tender and the rice is cooked through.

ingredients: Chicken pieces, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, coconut milk, spices like cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, black pepper, coriander seeds, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and curry leaves.
preparation: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices like turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Sauté onions, tomatoes, and curry leaves in oil, then add the marinated chicken and cook until the chicken is tender and the flavors meld together. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves.

ingredients: Rice flour, urad dal flour (ground urad dal), cumin seeds, sesame seeds, salt, water, and oil for frying.
preparation: Prepare a dough with rice flour, urad dal flour, cumin seeds, sesame seeds, asafoetida, butter, and salt. Shape the dough into spiral or circular patterns using a murukku press. Deep fry in hot oil until crispy and golden brown. Drain excess oil and serve as a crunchy snack.

ingredients: Basmati rice, chicken or meat, onions, tomatoes, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices like cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, bay leaves, red chili powder, turmeric powder, saffron, and nuts like cashews and raisins.
preparation: Marinate meat (usually chicken or mutton) with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices, and herbs. Parboil rice separately with whole spices. Layer the marinated meat and rice in a heavy-bottomed pot, along with fried onions, chopped mint, coriander leaves, saffron-infused milk, and ghee. Seal the pot with dough and cook on low heat until the meat is tender and the rice is cooked through.

ingredients: Gongura leaves (sorrel leaves), onions, green chilies, garlic, tamarind pulp, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and oil.
preparation: Saute gongura leaves (sorrel leaves) with mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, garlic, dried red chilies, and tamarind pulp until the leaves are cooked. Blend the mixture into a coarse paste, then temper with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and asafoetida.

ingredients: Large green chilies, chickpea flour (besan), rice flour, spices like cumin seeds, ajwain (carom seeds), turmeric powder, and salt.
preparation: Slit large green chilies lengthwise, remove seeds, and stuff with a mixture of spiced gram flour (besan) paste. Dip the stuffed chilies in a batter made of gram flour, rice flour, chili powder, turmeric, and salt. Deep fry until golden brown and crispy.

ingredients: Baby eggplants, peanuts, sesame seeds, coconut, onions, tomatoes, tamarind pulp, ginger-garlic paste, spices like mustard seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder.
preparation: Slit baby eggplants and stuff with a mixture of ground peanuts, sesame seeds, coconut, tamarind, and spices. Cook the stuffed eggplants in a tempering of mustard seeds, curry leaves, onions, ginger, garlic, and spices until tender and flavorful.

ingredients: Wheat, barley, meat (usually lamb or chicken), lentils (like chana dal and moong dal), spices like cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, ginger-garlic paste, fried onions, mint leaves, and coriander leaves.
preparation: Cook a mixture of lentils, meat (usually mutton or chicken), wheat, barley, and spices until everything is soft and mushy. Blend the mixture into a smooth paste. Sauté onions, garlic, ginger, and spices in ghee, then add the blended paste and cook until thickened. Serve hot, garnished with fried onions, lemon wedges, chopped coriander leaves, and a drizzle of ghee.

ingredients: Green gram (moong dal), rice, green chilies, ginger, cumin seeds, and salt.
preparation: Soak green gram (moong dal) and rice together for a few hours, then grind into a smooth batter. Ferment the batter overnight. Heat a griddle, pour a ladleful of batter, spread it thin, drizzle oil, and cook until crispy and golden brown. Serve hot with ginger chutney or coconut chutney.

ingredients: Meat (like lamb or chicken), yogurt, onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, spices like cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, bay leaves, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and ghee.
preparation: Marinate meat (usually chicken or mutton) with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices, and herbs. Seal the marinated meat in a heavy-bottomed pot along with rice and whole spices. Cook on low heat, allowing the flavors to meld together in their own steam, resulting in a flavorful and tender dish.

ingredients: Chicken pieces, onions, tomatoes, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, spices like cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and curry leaves.
preparation: Cook chicken pieces with onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, and spices until the chicken is tender and the gravy thickens. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

ingredients: Rice, tamarind pulp, peanuts, curry leaves, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and oil.
preparation: Cook rice and allow it to cool slightly. In a separate pan, temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, dried red chilies, and peanuts in oil. Add tamarind paste, turmeric, salt, and cooked rice to the tempering and mix well until evenly combined.

ingredients: Rice flour, sesame seeds, ajwain (carom seeds), salt, and oil for deep frying.
preparation: Prepare a dough with rice flour, sesame seeds, cumin seeds, carom seeds, and salt. Shape the dough into spiral or circular patterns using a sakinalu press. Deep fry in hot oil until crispy and golden brown. Drain excess oil and allow to cool before serving.

ingredients: Rice, lentils, spices, vegetables.
preparation: Chauk is a traditional Khasi dish made with smoked or grilled meat, typically pork or chicken. The meat is marinated with local spices and herbs, then slow-cooked until tender and flavorful. It's often served with rice or traditional flatbreads.

ingredients: Fish, herbs, spices, coconut milk.
preparation: Champrai is a Khasi dish made with tender bamboo shoots. The bamboo shoots are typically sliced and cooked with a variety of ingredients such as pork, ginger, garlic, onions, and local spices. It's a savory and aromatic dish often served with rice.

ingredients: Chicken, tomatoes, onions, spices, herbs.
preparation: Bwtwi is a traditional Khasi dish made with fermented soybeans. The soybeans are soaked, boiled, and then fermented for several days. They are then cooked with spices, garlic, ginger, and sometimes pork or other meats to create a flavorful and nutritious dish.

ingredients: Pork, bamboo shoots, ginger, garlic, chili peppers.
preparation: Mwkhwi is a Khasi dish made with fish, typically freshwater fish found in the rivers and streams of Meghalaya. The fish is cooked with local herbs, spices, and vegetables to create a delicious and aromatic curry. It's often served with rice or flatbreads.

ingredients: Beef, potatoes, carrots, onions, spices.
preparation: Chakhwi is a traditional Khasi dish made with vegetables such as pumpkin, beans, or potatoes. The vegetables are cooked with local spices, herbs, and sometimes meat or fish to create a hearty and flavorful stew. It's a popular dish in Khasi cuisine and is often served with rice.

ingredients: Mixed vegetables, tofu, soy sauce, ginger, garlic.
preparation: Muya Awandru is a Khasi dish made with fermented pork. The pork is marinated with local spices and herbs, then fermented for several days to develop its unique flavor. It's then cooked with ginger, garlic, onions, and chili peppers to create a spicy and tangy dish.

ingredients: Pork, beans, tomatoes, onions, chili peppers.
preparation: Kau Bru is a traditional Khasi dish made with mixed vegetables. The vegetables are typically stir-fried with ginger, garlic, onions, and local spices to create a flavorful and aromatic dish. It's often served as a side dish with rice or flatbreads.

ingredients: Pork, fermented bamboo shoots, green chilies, garlic, ginger.
preparation: Wahan Mosdeng is a Khasi dish made with smoked or grilled beef. The beef is typically marinated with local spices and herbs, then grilled or smoked to perfection. It's then served with a tangy and spicy sauce made with onions, chili peppers, and lime juice.

ingredients: Rice, coconut milk, sugar, salt.
preparation: Bangui Rice is a traditional Khasi dish made with red rice, a variety of rice native to Meghalaya. The rice is cooked with water or coconut milk until soft and fluffy, then served as a staple food with various Khasi dishes.

ingredients: Fish, mustard oil, turmeric, garlic, ginger.   some more ingediants
preparation: Moirui is a traditional Khasi dish made with fermented fish. The fish is typically marinated with local spices and herbs, then fermented for several days to develop its unique flavor. It's then cooked with vegetables, garlic, ginger, and chili peppers to create a spicy and tangy dish.

ingredients: Ash gourd (also known as winter melon or white pumpkin), sugar, water, lime juice, alum (for firmness).
preparation: Petha is a sweet candy made from ash gourd (winter melon). To prepare it, the ash gourd is peeled, deseeded, and cut into pieces. These pieces are then boiled in sugar syrup along with flavorings like rose water, saffron, or cardamom until translucent and candied.

ingredients: Basmati rice, chicken (or lamb), onions, tomatoes, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices (such as cumin, cardamom, cinnamon, cloves), saffron strands, ghee (clarified butter), nuts and raisins for garnish.
preparation: Nawabi Pulao is a rich and fragrant rice dish cooked with meat (usually chicken or mutton), aromatic spices like cardamom, cinnamon, and cloves, along with fried onions, nuts, and dried fruits. The meat is marinated, cooked with rice, and garnished with fried onions, nuts, and coriander leaves.

ingredients: Minced lamb or beef, raw papaya paste (to tenderize the meat), ginger-garlic paste, gram flour (besan), spices (such as garam masala, black pepper, cloves), saffron, kebab masala, ghee (clarified butter).
preparation: Tunday Kababi's Galouti Kebab is a famous dish from Lucknow known for its tender and melt-in-your-mouth texture. It's made with minced meat (usually lamb or beef) mixed with a blend of spices and tenderizers like raw papaya paste. The mixture is shaped into patties and shallow-fried until golden brown.

ingredients: Potatoes, green peas, green chilies, ginger, coriander leaves, chaat masala, amchur (dry mango powder), bread crumbs (or besan), oil for frying.
preparation: Aloo ki Tikki is a popular Indian street food made from mashed potatoes mixed with spices, chopped onions, green chilies, and fresh coriander leaves. The mixture is shaped into patties, coated in breadcrumbs or semolina, and shallow-fried until crispy and golden brown.

ingredients: Milk, cream, sugar, saffron, pistachios, almonds.
preparation: Makhan Malai is a light and airy dessert from Lucknow made with milk froth, saffron, sugar, and sometimes garnished with nuts and edible silver leaf. It's traditionally prepared during winters and served chilled.

ingredients: Betel leaves, areca nuts (supari), slaked lime (chuna), various fillings (such as fennel seeds, coconut, rose petal preserve, cardamom seeds), sweeteners (such as gulkand or sugar syrup).
preparation: Banarasi Paan is a traditional digestive and mouth freshener from Varanasi (Banaras). It's made by wrapping betel leaves around a mixture of areca nut, slaked lime (calcium hydroxide), tobacco (optional), and various flavorings like rose petal preserves, fennel seeds, cardamom, and sweet syrups.

ingredients: Milk, sugar, lemon juice or vinegar, water.
preparation: Rasgulla is a popular Bengali sweet made from fresh paneer (Indian cottage cheese) kneaded into a smooth dough, shaped into balls, and cooked in sugar syrup until light and spongy. It's a light and delicate dessert often enjoyed on festive occasions.

ingredients: Milk, sugar, condensed milk, saffron, cardamom powder, pistachios, almonds, cashews, cornstarch.
preparation: Kulfi is a traditional Indian ice cream made from thickened milk, flavored with cardamom, saffron, or pistachios. The milk is cooked until it reduces and thickens, then poured into molds and frozen until set. Kulfi has a dense and creamy texture.

ingredients: For Bedmi Poori - wheat flour, urad dal (black gram lentils), spices (such as cumin, coriander, red chili powder), oil for frying. For Aloo Sabzi - Potatoes, tomatoes, onions, ginger, garlic, spices (such as turmeric, cumin, coriander), oil.
preparation: Bedmi Poori is a North Indian fried bread made from wheat flour dough mixed with ground lentils and spices. The dough is rolled out into discs and deep-fried until puffed and golden brown. It's often served with a spicy potato curry (Aloo Sabzi).

ingredients: For Kachori - All-purpose flour, urad dal (black gram lentils), spices (such as fennel seeds, coriander powder, red chili powder), oil for frying. For Sabzi - Potatoes, tomatoes, onions, ginger, garlic, spices (such as turmeric, cumin, coriander), oil.
preparation: Kachori is a deep-fried pastry filled with a spicy mixture of lentils, onions, and spices. The dough is made from wheat flour and stuffed with the filling before frying. It's typically served with a tangy and spicy potato curry (Sabzi) or chutneys.

ingredients: Spinach (or other leafy greens), fenugreek leaves, green chili peppers, garlic, ginger, cumin seeds, coriander powder, turmeric powder, ghee (clarified butter), salt.
preparation: Kafuli is a traditional dish from Uttarakhand, India, made with spinach (usually green leafy vegetables like lamb's quarters) and fenugreek leaves cooked with besan (gram flour), garlic, ginger, and spices. The mixture is simmered until the flavors meld together, creating a thick and nutritious gravy.

ingredients: Bhang (cannabis) seeds, fresh coriander leaves, green chili peppers, garlic cloves, lemon juice, salt.
preparation: Bhang Ki Chutney is a chutney made with ground hemp seeds (bhang seeds), green chilies, garlic, lemon juice, and salt. The ingredients are blended into a coarse paste, resulting in a spicy and tangy condiment often served with snacks or meals.

ingredients: Mixed lentils (such as urad dal, rajma, chana dal), whole spices (such as cumin seeds, cloves, cinnamon), ginger-garlic paste, green chili peppers, turmeric powder, ghee (clarified butter), salt.
preparation: Phaanu is a traditional dish from Uttarakhand, India, made with a combination of lentils (usually a mix of urad dal and rajma) soaked overnight, ground into a coarse paste, and cooked with spices like cumin, coriander, and turmeric until thick and creamy. It's typically served with rice or roti.

ingredients: Whole wheat flour, ghee (clarified butter), water, sugar, cardamom powder.
preparation: Dubuk is a hearty and nutritious dish from Uttarakhand, India, made with mixed grains like barley, wheat, and lentils cooked with vegetables like potatoes, spinach, and radishes. The grains and vegetables are simmered in water with spices until soft and flavorful, creating a thick and comforting stew.

ingredients: Horse gram lentils, garlic, ginger, green chili peppers, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, coriander powder, ghee (clarified butter), salt.
preparation: Gahat Ki Dal is a traditional dish from Uttarakhand, India, made with horse gram lentils cooked with garlic, ginger, tomatoes, and spices like cumin, coriander, and turmeric until soft and creamy. It's often served with rice or roti and garnished with coriander leaves.

ingredients: Finger millet flour (ragi), water, ghee (clarified butter), jaggery (or sugar), cardamom powder.
preparation: Kachmauli is a traditional dish from Uttarakhand, India, made with potatoes and spinach cooked together with onions, garlic, ginger, and spices like cumin, coriander, and turmeric until soft and flavorful. It's typically served as a side dish with rice or roti.

ingredients: Black gram lentils (urad dal), whole spices (such as cumin seeds, cloves, cinnamon), ginger-garlic paste, green chili peppers, turmeric powder, ghee (clarified butter), salt.
preparation: Chainsoo is a traditional dish from Uttarakhand, India, made with black gram lentils (urad dal) cooked with spices like cumin, coriander, and asafoetida until thick and creamy. It's often tempered with ghee, garlic, and dried red chilies for added flavor.

ingredients: Coconut, jaggery (or sugar), cardamom powder, saffron strands, ghee (clarified butter).
preparation: Singhodi is a traditional sweet dish from Uttarakhand, India, made with singhara flour (water chestnut flour) cooked with jaggery, ghee, and spices like cardamom and nutmeg until thick and aromatic. It's typically served as a dessert during festivals and special occasions.

ingredients: Potatoes, mustard oil, cumin seeds, asafoetida (hing), turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, amchur (dry mango powder), salt.
preparation: Aloo Ke Gutke is a popular dish from Uttarakhand, India, made with boiled potatoes sautéed with onions, garlic, ginger, and spices like cumin, coriander, and turmeric until crispy and golden brown. It's often served as a side dish with rice or roti.

ingredients: Black soybeans (bhatt), whole spices (such as cumin seeds, cloves, cinnamon), ginger-garlic paste, green chili peppers, turmeric powder, coriander powder, ghee (clarified butter), salt.
preparation: Bhatt Ki Churdkani is a traditional dish from Uttarakhand, India, made with black soybeans (bhatt dal) cooked with onions, tomatoes, garlic, ginger, and spices like cumin, coriander, and turmeric until soft and flavorful. It's often served with rice or roti.

ingredients: Fish (such as rohu or hilsa), potatoes, tomatoes, onions, ginger, garlic, green chili peppers, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, mustard oil, water, salt.
preparation: Macher Jhol is a Bengali fish curry made with freshwater fish (typically rohu or hilsa) cooked in a light and flavorful gravy. The fish is marinated with turmeric and salt, then fried until golden brown. Meanwhile, a gravy is prepared with onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, and spices like cumin, coriander, and turmeric. The fried fish is added to the gravy and simmered until cooked through.

ingredients: Milk, lemon juice (or vinegar), sugar, saffron strands (optional), cardamom powder, nuts for garnish (such as pistachios or almonds).
preparation: Shondesh is a popular Bengali sweet made from fresh paneer (Indian cottage cheese) and sugar. The paneer is kneaded until smooth, then mixed with sugar and flavored with cardamom, saffron, or rose water. The mixture is shaped into small discs or balls and garnished with nuts or dried fruits.

ingredients: Potatoes, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chili peppers, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, mustard oil, water, salt.
preparation: Alur Dom is a traditional Bengali potato curry made with baby potatoes cooked in a spicy and aromatic gravy. The potatoes are first boiled until tender, then fried until golden brown. Meanwhile, a gravy is prepared with onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, and spices like cumin, coriander, and garam masala. The fried potatoes are added to the gravy and simmered until coated with the sauce.

ingredients: All-purpose flour (maida), water, salt, oil for frying.
preparation: Luchi is a deep-fried flatbread made from refined flour (maida) and ghee. The dough is kneaded with water and salt, then rolled out into small discs and deep-fried until puffed and golden brown. Luchi is often served with spicy curries or sweet dishes.

ingredients: Milk, lemon juice or vinegar, sugar, water, cardamom pods, saffron strands (optional).
preparation: Rosogolla, also known as Rasgulla, is a popular Bengali sweet made from fresh paneer (Indian cottage cheese) kneaded until smooth, then shaped into small balls and cooked in sugar syrup until soft and spongy. Rosogollas are typically served chilled and garnished with saffron or rose petals.

ingredients: Hilsa fish, mustard seeds, mustard oil, green chili peppers, turmeric powder, salt.
preparation: Shorshe Ilish is a traditional Bengali dish made with Hilsa fish cooked in a mustard sauce. The fish pieces are marinated with turmeric and salt, then fried until golden brown. Meanwhile, a mustard sauce is prepared with mustard paste, green chilies, turmeric, and mustard oil. The fried fish is added to the mustard sauce and simmered until cooked through.

ingredients: Potatoes, poppy seeds (posto), green chili peppers, mustard oil, turmeric powder, salt.
preparation: Aloo Posto is a classic Bengali dish made with potatoes cooked in a poppy seed paste. The potatoes are boiled until tender, then sautéed with onions, green chilies, and poppy seed paste. The dish is flavored with turmeric, mustard oil, and sometimes nigella seeds.

ingredients: Shrimp (prawns), coconut milk, onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chili peppers, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, mustard oil, water, salt.
preparation: Chingri Macher Malai Curry is a Bengali dish made with prawns cooked in a creamy coconut milk sauce. The prawns are marinated with turmeric and salt, then cooked in a gravy made with onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, coconut milk, and spices like cumin, coriander, and garam masala.

ingredients: Chana dal (Bengal gram lentils), coconut, ginger, green chili peppers, cinnamon, cloves, bay leaf, ghee (clarified butter), sugar, salt.
preparation: Cholar Dal is a traditional Bengali dish made with Bengal gram lentils (chana dal) cooked with coconut, raisins, and spices. The lentils are boiled until soft, then sautéed with onions, ginger, garlic, green chilies, and spices like cumin, coriander, and turmeric.

ingredients: Milk, sugar, yogurt culture.
preparation: Misti Doi is a sweet yogurt dessert from Bengal made by caramelizing sugar and adding it to boiled milk. The milk is then fermented with yogurt culture until thick and creamy. Misti Doi is typically served chilled and garnished with nuts or saffron.
